description:
excellent food 
very satisfied customers service
                                                                                              
and not expensive
author: SaNgee S.

description:
One of my Thai restaurant in Bay area!

When I go to Benjarong Thai, I usually order sizzling party seafood and side order of coconut rice which is a good combination. They also do Thai style drinks(Thai lce tea) and desserts (Mango w/ sweet sticky rice) - the perfect dinner. There's usually no wait to be seated or crowded and their service is very friendly and nice.

All in all I highly recommended this place to you guys. Their food is so delicious and authentic.
author: Pop J.

description: I am a vegetarian from India to give some context. I tried their lunch special which included an appetizer, soup, entree or curry. I got vegetable soup, pumpkin curry and rice (got more curry instead of appetizer). Soup was ok but had lots of veggies, curry was delicious (a little spicy for 3/5 but still yum) with lots of veggies. Wish they included small portion of dessert as well.
author: Deepti S.

description: Went there with my fiancé and we absolutely loved it. We were quite skeptical when we entered as we were the only one there but the food was great. We ordered the tofu fry, yellow curry, pineapple chicken fried rice and chicken pad Thai. Each dish tasted amazing. The Chicken Pad Thai was a little sweet for my palette but the hostess was able to understand that from my face and served me with some Thai chili which was mind blowing. I loved it and I was so glad she understood her customers. Big shoutout to her! Will definitely go back again.
author: Fathima M.

description: Long time Thai food lovers first time at Benjarong. Got the Pad See Ew with beef and Pumpkin Curry with chicken plus the Fresh Shrimp Spring rolls. Super legit, very happy with the order.  The pumpkin curry had a nice little spice to it and the Pad See Ew was just the right touch of greasy.  Definitely would recommend this for take out.  Will be back.
author: Matt B.

description: Delicious. The fresh rolls were super fresh and had delicious mint & cilantro.  The Pad See Ew is a must order.
author: Peggy S.

description:
Food was decent aside from the artichoke heart that still had the hair attached (??).

three stars because they gave me the bill without a listed subtotal, then attempted to suggest me a tip calculated after tax. I had to ask for a full bill with the items listed and the subtotal.. shady.
author: Rox A.

description:
We have certainly had better food, their prices were very reasonable,
but unfortunately I don't think we will return.
Both our dishes were extremely HOT, spice HOT...
author: Judy K.

description: Benjarong is the best!  Consistently delicious food.  Very nicely decorated environment to dine in, and such friendly people.  Also great for take-out!  I love this place and have for years!!!
author: Patrick B.

description: Great take out spot!  Loved the Pad Sea Ye and the Pumpkin curry. Haven't done sit down here. But looks cute inside.
author: Amanda C.

description:
I have been too many Thai restaurant recently, they have increase price dramatically except for this restaurant, the average price for chicken is $9.95 while other Thai restaurant will cost you $11 +.
I love the Pad Thai here. The flavor is very rich and explode in my mouth. And service was great too.
Let's put this in the nutshell, go to this place and you will like it.
author: Omega A.

description: This place is dirty. The food wasn't much in quality and we just couldn't wait to run away from this restaurant.
author: L D.

description:
Great venue for hosting a private party. We had over 30 people and the venue is perfect for our crowd size. Ordering was easy and straightforward as they already have catering menu prepared. Food came out on time and they were delicious! Owner also gave us complimentary fruit cup for our guests which was a nice touch. We had a lot of leftovers as some guests left early, the staff neatly boxed food into individual boxes which made it easy for people to take home so no food was wasted!

Highly recommend this place if you plan large group dinner.
author: William C.

description: Amazing curry including the pumpkin curry. This is one of my favorite Thai restaurants.  I just finished the lemongrass with brown rice and tofu. To die for!
author: Leila C.

description:
Pros:
Very good food- we enjoyed the green curry, pineapple fried rice, pad see ew & Thai basil with tofu! Would suggest each of these dishes and they complimented each other well so good for sharing amongst a group. 
Location location location- Right next to Dhole's apartment. 

Cons:
Eerily quiet atmosphere that's reminiscent of a retirement community.
Pretty quick service however it was obvious our waitress was in training. 
Had to ask for water to be refilled (a pet peeve of mine).
author: Alyssa C.

description:
Food:

I've had the lunch combination and come here for dinner.

Lunch combination: Very good deal for money (appetizer + soup + entree+ rice). I wish it had noodles as part of the combination but their curries are really good. I was able to get vegetarian substitutions and they swapped white rice for brown rice. Thai hot basil was moderately spicy, sweet and tasted good but nothing spectacular.

They do have noodles outsides of the combination but the combo is such a good deal during lunch, I would stick to it.

Pumpkin curry: Very good and better than the Thai Hot Basil. I asked for it extra spicy and it was really spicy. One of the better curries I've had at a thai restaurant.

Service: Very fast as the place is usually empty
author: Neil P.

description: The pad Thai noodles are very thin. The asparagus and scallops dish is not a lot of food. They cut up one scallop into multiple pieces to make it appear as if you are eating more scallops. There's probably a max of maybe 3 scallops (probably 2) in the whole dish
author: Beth K.

description: Love Benjarong!!!! Benjarong has been my go-to Thai spot for take out! My friends suggested it to me and it's been consistently delicious from curries to pad see ew. I'd love to see them promote in-restaurant dining through something like promotions to get more traffic through the door.
author: Annie A.

description:
I ran into this place earlier this year, and now make it out here once a month.   They have great lunch specials available with entree or curry options while providing soup to start.  I have never been here for dinner, so my comments about the service are for lunch only. 

The lady that works at lunch time is always so nice, and provides great service every time we visit. She gladly brings out the Thai chili condiments, and constantly checks to refill your water.  The ambiance is pleasant, the lighting is dim to create an intimate feeling.  

I have tried all the curries (red, yellow, green, and mango) with the exception of the pumpkin curry.  They are all very good, the yellow curry is mildest while the green curry is the spiciest option. I usually order the Thai samosas as a side, but sometimes order the chicken satay to get extra protein. Never ordered dessert, but they have a few unique options like a dish called "bomba" that looks like a coconut ball with some berry filling. 

I highly recommend this place if you're craving Thai food, and are near the Marina district. The food is great, and the service is excellent!  I rate this place 4.5 stars overall, and will continue to return.
author: Marlon T.

description: Great place for take out! The pad see yew, basil eggplant chicken, and mango sticky rice were great last night! Prices are decent (significantly cheaper than Yukol down the street, who keeps raising their prices, but quality and taste here are the same) and portions are generous.  It can be slow- I think their kitchen is small and an order can take 30+ minutes, so call ahead.  Not much else to add; it's delicious basic Thai food for those nights you just want to order in familiar Asian food to eat in your pjs.  The restaurant space is quiet and clean but really small.
author: Kari L.

description:
I came in on a Friday night with my girlfriend and was told to sit next to what seemed to be someone's office setup on one of the tables. The restaurant was empty so we moved a table across. After that, we were rudely told that we had to move because it could get "busy". I rarely have bad reviews, but this place really can be summed up in one word: Regret

I've ordered take out and had better service, don't bother coming in. We ended up going to Ly's Vietnamese across the street that had great service and delicious food at an affordable price... Good bye and good riddance Benjarong
author: Jony V.

description: I'm so glad I stumbled across this place!  I came in about an hour before closing so there weren't too many people there which was nice.  Service was quick and incredibly polite!  Got my food and drink super quick!  I ordered the Prawns with Fried Rice and it was ahhhmazing!  I'm definitely getting it again next time I'm in the area.
author: Cory D.

description: This place is such a neighborhood gem. The food is consistently good and the people are always so wonderful and kind. The interior is quiet and nicely decorated. Ordering pickup is always fast and easy. Thanks, Benjarong!
author: Erica S.

description:
I've had a lot of Thai Yellow Curry at different places around the city and in the East Bay but this is by far my favorite. They're kinda skimpy on the rice so if I'm eating at home I'll just make my own. Delish flavors! And when they say "Mild, Medium, or Hot" for spice level... Hot means "you might cry" (My boyfriend who loves spicy food has even had to move down to mild on some of their items because the spice is intense!)

I strongly recommend this place. The staff is sweet, the location is easy to access, the food is sublime.
author: Mandy R.

description:
Friendly staff although I have been ordering take out that is delivered to my house periodically. 

I finally ventured Into the restaurant to dine for once and to my horror the restaurant is filthy inside. My sneakers were sticking to the ground 

I won't be ordering again, I don't trust their hygiene.
author: Michael M.

description:
Order food for togo, pad se ew and chicken satay, the peanut sauce that comes with the chicken satay here is absolutely impeccable, I do like the sauce.
Moreover, the portion is enough to fill me up based on their resonable price. I used to go to other restaurant and I spent 20 bucks but it took me two hours then i hungry again. So ordering the food here is the good choice if you are looking for good meal.
author: Pajaree N.

description: We were staying at a hotel pretty close to here and chose to have delivery via EAT24 from Benjarong Thai Cuisine. Ordered a lot of food. It was all delicious! I can't compare it to other Thai places in the area, but it's up there with some of my favorites around the country! The delivery took over an hour, strange since they were less than a block away and it was pretty late in the evening, but I'm not sure if we were using their delivery person or if EAT24 has their own, so I'm not taking away any stars for that. Spicy Lamb was amazing! Their Thai tea tasted different than any other I've had so that's where the missing star comes from, along with a "mushy" feeling spring roll, although it tasted fine. We would order from here again if in the area.
author: Jen T.

description: Lunch review.  First the service is slow. On a weekday lunch, it took 25 minutes to get food from entering the door. The restaurant was near empty. The soup in the lunch combo was chicken broth with some vegetables and tasted like MSG.  I thought about walking out after a sip of the soup. The curry and the satay was actually good. The fried noodle was just okay. The texture of the noodle was mushy.  The noodle tasted like residue detergent from the wok.
author: Stink C.

description: This review is based on our experience with employees only.  I cannot vouch for the food.  We got there exactly at 11:00 am on a Tuesday.  An employee was outside washing the window when we walked up.  The closed sign was on the door.  I asked:  What time do you open?  He replied 11:00, but the chef isn't here, it's Tuesday.  Then he giggled.  I said ok and  we left.
author: Jan F.

description:
Excellent food and service. Not sure why some people complained about this place. Probably because most of the people that live in this neighborhood are spoiled little brats lol. Most have never had to work hard a day in their pathetic self absorbed lives. 

It was well decorated and the staff is friendly. The menus need to be cleaned though.
author: Chris H.

description:
First time here, worst thai food ever!!!! 
we ordered tom yum soup.. Blah...too sweet.. Waste of $11., i don't know what they put in it.  Very disappointing. 
then the fried rice, there are more onions and tomatoes than the rice. 
Next the phad thai, its alright, the noodles are too thin. It's not the ordinary thick flat noodle.  

Overall, service wAs good, food are over priced and very small servings. Not worth it!
author: J N.

description:
I have visited few good thai restaurants around SF and this has always be on the top of list.
The decor is traditional ,the service staff are friendly and very knowledgeable of the ingredients used in food , they also give great recommendations based on personal taste. This time i ordered Thai Sukhi Sukhi and artichoke salad and i was delighted by the food presentation and freshness. So I feel i should recommend this spot.
author: Jim T.

description: Excellent meals!  Pineapple rice, panang curry with chicken. All good - great service. Everyone check it out.
author: Barb M.

description: I used to love this place but it's gone downhill. Placed an order for pick up and it took 45+ minutes. I waited in the restaurant for 25+ of those minutes and didn't even get an apology. I should mention the restaurant was empty. Will not be returning.
author: Jane F.

description: Mediocre.  I am staying across street at Del Sol hotel and ran into this place because its within 200 yards.  The menus are dirty.  The service is ok.  The Panang Seafood curry lacked flavor and the seafood was a couple of small frozen shrimp and chunks of no-name fish... I didnt trust the mussels -- a bit funky smell... so passed.  The rice was cool and pasty... not enough to cover the meal and they dont offer more.  Its just barely ok...this place.  I would not return here.  Over $20 bucks for beer, undersized mediocre-minus Curry ... oh well... fair warning to you.
author: David G.

description:
This is one of the best decorated Thai restaurants I've come across in San Francisco. From the window coverings to the decorative lighting, the interior design contributes to an atmosphere conducive to the enjoyment of your meal. The walls have paintings and Thai artifacts pleasantly distributed in the rather large dining area. The television near the bar seems out of place. Maybe they should kill it. 

Both times I've visited, the service has been slower than other places I've eaten. Even the cup of soup that comes with your lunch took some time to arrive at the table. But, the slow food still tasted great. 

The pumpkin curry I ordered came with soft tofu. It was the consistency of a firm jello. That was nice compared to the soft tofu that typically falls apart in the dish. The tough rind on the pumpkin was cut into serrations and into uniform sizes. It was the consistency of a firm tofu; not mushy at all. 

They serve the freshest coconut in the shell I have ever eaten. The flesh came off the shell easily and in large, tasty bites. It alone would be worth a visit to this restaurant. A definite must have drink. 

I normally don't take pictures of my food, but the desert menu looked so good, I had to show it. One of my return visits will surely include desert.
author: Ken R.

description:
Friendly service, but food was just average.  Our asparagus scallops came on a sizzling platter but the ingredients were lukewarm... I was puzzled about why they used a sizzling platter if they had no intention of heating/cooking the food on it to bring out more flavor... Scallops were barely cooked.  Chicken satay was pretty good, we did a reorder.

Price was decent for the amount of food we had, and ambiance was good... Overall dining experience was acceptable.
author: Adrienne K.

description: The food is average, the service is terrible. The phone did not stop ringing and the waitress was mostly laughing in the kitchen. I asked some lemons for the Pad Thai... it tooks her 10 minutes and we were only 2 couples in... would not come back !
author: Celine D.

description: Just popped in here to pick up some take out, but this place is legit. Very friendly service in a beautiful setting makes this a spot I would definitely bring a date. Nice to see the ServSafe certification above the bar as well. Legitimate menu with a varied selection of Thai favorites, the aroma wafting out of the kitchen has my mouth watering.
author: Scott D.

description:
I saw this place was rated very highly (4.5 stars) on tripadvisor so I decided to go here. Went there Saturday night around 7:30pm and it was quite empty to my surprise. Anyway, I am going to summarize my experience instead do writing an epic essay. 

Service - 1 star; slow, inattentive
Food - 2.5 stars: mediocre at best 
Ambiance - 3 stars: although we had to asked them to play some music (without music this would be 2 stars)

The pan fried noodles were pretty good. Everything else was just blah.
author: Jan L.

description: Great Thai food here! I've been here for several times during the past year. The lunch special is delicious and convenient. Love pad Thai and fried rice! Staff here are really friendly as well.
author: Sain X.

description: Last night i went to this restaurant and i was surprised why it gets low star on yelp. The service was excelent, the server did every to make sure that i got everything i need. The foods were bomb, especially pad se ew, which tastes even better than the one that i had in Thailand. Spend your bucks here and u won't be dissapointed.
author: Earn K.

description:
As I've continued to patron this place, I've liked it more and more for it's quality.

If you accept that the service is not speedy and you're not going in for a quick bite, the food here is really, really good. I've ordered a lot of different things here by now and have never been disappointed - they've consistently been close to the best when compared to the same dish at other thai places.Thai samosas, fresh spring rolls, and crispy spring rolls are all tasty. Red and green curries are very good too. Had a bite of my friend's more adventures soft shell crab basil dish, which was absolutely delicious - will order that next time I eat in.

Upgrading from 3 to 4 stars, and will keep coming back :)
author: Sarah B.

description: I ordered the red curry and the veggies came almost raw and the chicken was blandly boiled. Further, rice was not included in the price but I had requested it online so they put it in the bag and had it rung up ($2.95 for rice.....) so I could not really say I didn't want it. The curry flavor was the only redeeming quality.
author: Leanna B.

description: I have only ordered pick up. The Curry is great, I have tried a few other items that were not impressive. Great curry and friendly staff.
author: Robert S.

description: Ate in. Had the red curry with samosas. Delicious! Nice break from the bland foods of chestnut and union. Definitely making this place a regular stop.
author: Klaus S.

description:
Superb Thai delivery via Eat24. 
I was craving Thai delivery food one night and I came across this restaurant online with some fairly good reviews. I decided to order through the Eat24 app and was pleasantly surprised with not only delicious Thai food but also an early delivery! 

Things I ordered: chicken, salad cucumber salad, pumpkin curry with chicken, and pineapple fried rice. I would definitely order all of these again as they were all piping hot and delicious when they arrived at my home.  

I will definitely be ordering from them again!
author: Thomas A.

description:
I think that this place is super underrated. I've lived next door to this location for 4 years and didn't start really eating at Benjarong, consistently, until about 2 years ago and wish I had all along!

Any one of their curry dishes are great and I especially like the Tom Kha soup, it's so tasty! The liquid is the perfect thickness and the veggies and meat are so good.

I highly recommend this place if you don't want to spend too much or but also don't want to eat fast food. Try the dishes I recommended and you'll be satisfied.
author: Corey R.

description: Finally, a Thai restaurant that actually made the food like I requested: Thai spicy! I was sweating and needed lots of water. Perfect! Very good food and friendly service. Quiet place, usually fairly empty (I believe they do mostly take out) but nice décor. Try the salmon roll. Very good ! The NY steak (yes, that's right!) is actually very good, although I had it a couple of years ago. Not much foot traffic in that part of Lombard but worth the trip!
author: R T.

description: I'm shocked his place doesn't have 5 stars. I ordered the pad se eww and Tom yum seafood soup, just like I do at all Thai food restaurants, and this place makes it the best. Food is awesome here and I will definitely be back.
author: Ryan B.

description:
expensive, small portions, horrible service, insane delivery time... and when you call and ask how long, they lie and keep saying 10 minutes, even though it's been another 30.

SAVE YOUR $, DO NOT SPEND IT HERE
author: Phillip B.

description:
This is for delivery only:
Big portions and delivered hot! My new fave is their pumpkin curry and I highly recommend getting a side of brown rice to pair with it! I also really like their side of cumber salad. It's very simple fresh ingredients that is a great combo of crunch and flavor. I usually get the Pad Thai but have to say this is my least favorite. I need to branch out and try one of their other noodle dishes. The shrimp fresh rolls are solid but the peanut sauce they came with was so thick that I ended up using the pumpkin curry as the dipping sauce....yum! It did take about an hour for delivery, but they told me that upfront when I placed my order, so it was no problem :-)
author: Mel A.

description:
This place was a very cute place to get lunch with my friend. I would like to give this place 3.5 stars but i will round down. The reason I wouldn't give them a perfect score is because a couple of our items arrived to our table at room temperature which was a little discomforting, we had to send it back to have the plate heated up. Why would you want scallops cold in the middle? Other than scallops everything tasted very good.  

For starters we got the satay chicken, which was perfect besides it not being hot when it got to our table. It was still a little warm but we overlooked it because we were starving.  To share we ordered the scallops with asparagus (was sent back to due to being cold in the middle), Tom yum fried rice (which was full of flavor), and the green curry with chicken. The dishes ranged from $8 to $14 and that felt a little on the pricey side compared to what I'm used to in San Jose. 

The drinks were reasonable, my Sapporo was $3.75 and my friends mango martini was $6 and her drink was delicious. 

Overall we had great service, the waitress came back and asked how the food was and refilled our drinks as needed. We will definitely give this place another try and will try to make it in for their lunch specials which end at 3:00pm. Hopefully everything will be hot when it gets to the table!
author: Cassandra C.

description:
Best Thai I've had in California (except for the home cooking of my stepmom who's Thai)!

Tonight we stopped in with only a half hour to stay, and they were very prompt!  The papaya salad here is awesome, and somehow the pad Thai was even tastier than ever!

My boyfriend love spicy foods, but I once ordered his papaya salad on the spicy side and his ears began fuming.  VERY SPICY!  i order mine on the low-medium side of spicy.  For him, we've determined the medium (regular) spiciness is just right.  Really good!
author: Cuppy C.

description: I loved the service here. Super nice waiter. Spring rolls to die for. Also everything with peanut says. Will be back to try more dishes as very happy with my first visit.
author: Hanna A.

description:
Great food! Even better for take out!
We were staying at Hotel Del Sol across the street, and in their lobby they had a menu for this restaurant and it said free delivery. We were just really worn out on Sunday of our trip, and figured what the heck. We had the pad see ewe with beef, and the fried rice with fried prawns. It arrived quickly, was in actually high quality resealable plastic containers and oh my gosh it was just delicious. I am sad we were on vacation, because I would go back here often!
author: Omi P.

description: 3.5 stars. Really nice waitress with an interesting cat-themed shirt. Otherwise, solid but unremarkable Thai food.  Good for right before karaoke at Silver Clouds karaoke.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Best green curry in town
Love their food 
We always order delivery and they never disappointed us
author: Tarek Z.

description: This Restaurant is very romantic and quite quaint with charm. The Atmosphere Is just as lovely. The menu is quite impressive. The service was upscale and friendly. I Enjoyed this semi hidden Thai jem on Lombard Street and would defenitely be back. The food was delicious and the presentation was delightful. Portions are a bit small for the pricing but I enjoyed my experience here!
author: Julian I.

description:
So, let me start by saying that I did see this business on the show "Check Please" and being a HUGE fan of Thai food the show immediately sparked my interest!

After finally making it out to the city to give this place a try I must say that I was not overly impressed by the food. The TV shows reviewers certainly blew it up more than they should have unless of course the restaurant was having an off day?

There were a few of us so we decided to order various items so that we could share and try different areas of the menu. :)

We ordered:

Pineapple Fried Rice
Pad Thai(seafood combo)
Fresh Spring Roll(shrimp)
Hot Basil W/Beef
BBQ Chicken Plate
Sticky and Jasmine Rice


The Pineapple rice came out in a simple dish... :( 

So I was disappointed in the presentation. On the show and in the menu they show it being served in a half shell Pineapple and this was not the case. :( When we asked the server - They said that they only do that sometimes.. Oh well.

To detail the actual food - This dish was good. I would reorder this even though the presentation wasn't what I expected. The pineapple chunks definitely seemed to be fresh and not out of a can. They were large and sweet and not soggy or small. We enjoyed this dish.

The Pad Thai was somewhat small in size but the variety of seafood mix was good. The only thing I would point out on this dish is that it was lacking some of that Thai flavor you would find in a good Pad Thai and that it was unfortunately OVERCOOKED which of course made some of the seafood items slightly chewy.   
:(  A BIG no no when doing seafood....


The only other issue is that the Sticky Rice was not so stick but extremely hard. 


All the other dishes were excellent. So, all in all everything was good but there are a few things that could have went better. I didn't deem these imperfections that bad to complain but on an evening when you are the only people in there you would expect things to go flawless. There were no big distractions to inflict the issues. Either way I am not sure if I will go back since there wasn't really any big WOW factor and the fact that there are quite a few Thai Restaurants in the Bay Area. 

As for the server, She was very nice and very attentive. She certainly was on top of it with the drinks and refilling.

Restaurant location. Right on Lombard and bring your walking shoes. They only have street parking available and with all the Motels and other businesses and Apartments it might prove difficult to find something right in front.
author: Rj H.

description:
This place is empty for lunch, so quick service. I ordered take-out and ordered a beer while I waited. I had the pumpkin curry lunch special. I did order (and pay $1 extra) for brown rice, but received white rice instead. Really annoyed with that. If you don't have it or don't want to cook it, fine, just don't make me pay extra for it and be disappointed. Other than that, the prices are cheap. I had a lunch combo that came with soup, $10 for everything. 

It was good, but I probably won't return because of the rice incident. There are a lot of other options in the area.
author: Carlynn A.

description: Really liked the yellow curry and crispy Indian bread to go with it. The hostess was very hospitable, and gave us a space heater when it got a little cold. Not busy at all on Saturday night, so the service was fast. I really enjoyed it!
author: Andrew P.

description:
Two stars because I ate here once before and it was pretty good.  Based on that experience I decided to treat a friend to lunch today.

We were the only ones in the restaurant so I didn't think it would take very long for our food.  Could not have been more wrong!  The service started off ok but then everyone disappeared to the back while we waited for food for at least 20 minutes.  My water glass stayed empty.  25 minutes in HALF of my lunch arrives and nothing for my friend.  Everyone disappears to the back again and another 15 minutes go by.  No napkins were ever brought to the table so I ended up using my shorts to wipe my hands.  Gross!  

After 40 minutes and no food for my friend we called time of death.  The excuse given was that pork friend rice takes a long time.  I guess my spring rolls took 40 minutes too.  The waitress was not appologetic but in fact quite rude.

The half of the food that came was just meh.  Too many Thai restaurants in SF for this poor level of service and food quality.  I will not be taking any friends here again.  Color me embarrassed!
author: Chris P.

description:
I wish I can give them a 0, worst customer service. It's hot in the restaurant and the food was dry and way to spicy. 

I live around the corner and wanted to find a good Thai place close, I would never go again. 

Save you money and time.
author: James A.

description:
After a sub-par experience a few years back, I re-returned.

and we're really happy we did.

about to have our second round of  Benji-thai in two days.

Pad Thai is delicious (we go with the chicken-only version), the panang (red) curry beef is huge and with rice lasts for a few meals, and the tom kha gai soup trumps Yukol Thai down the street by a few stars.

Tip: make sure you ask for chopsticks and extra peanut sauce or you won't get any.
author: Mike V.

description: Hands down- the best meal I've ever had! This place is amazing- the decor is beautiful, it wasn't too crowded, the waitresses were great, and did I mention the food was delicious?! I started with a mango Cosmo- not too sweet, not too much alcohol, and great mango flavor. Then I had the Tofu Satay appetizer. The marinated tofu was so delicious, it had grill marks and a nice hint of smokey flavor, a delicious peanut sauce paste, and a light, refreshing cucumber salad side. I also had the Praram entree with tofu. It was delicious and was very flavorful. They definitely know what to do with tofu- which is a rare find. They also have beautiful desserts I will have to try next time!
author: Caroline S.

description:
A very good Thai food option if you are around Marina district in San Francisco. It is a short walk from Chesnut and Fillmore Street. Next time if you are pubbing around Chesnut Street give this place a try.
We tried Pineapple fried rice, Pumpking curry and Basil chicken. All the dishes were tasty and well done. The service was friendly and fast. We were there around 7pm and I was surprised that they were not very crowded. They do have a decent wine selection. I would recommend this place after a good hike or walk around Fort Mason.
author: Raman S.

description: Disappointing.  Used to love this place but it has gone very sour for me.  Should have known when the place is EMPTY on a Friday night in the city.  VERY expensive, poor food and HORRIFIC service even when the place is dead!  New management please.
author: Lynne P.

description:
I'm very sad to write this review on Benjarong because it has been my go-to Thai spot in the city for the past 5+ years. However, they showed a pretty big level of disrespect toward a customer (me) so I feel I have no choice but to share a bad recent experience as a warning to future patrons.

Last week I ordered delivery (via Seamless, which is awesome) and Benjarong messed up my order. I ordered Pad Thai with veggies in place of the chicken and shrimp, but still including the tofu. I had to have some protein! When it arrived, it didn't have the Tofu included, so I called to let them know that they had messed up my order and I'd like to either A.) be credited for my meal since it was incorrect or B.) have someone delivery me what I ordered.

The restaurant was incredibly difficult, not offering to do anything about the mistake and they kept claiming that I had "already accepted" the food... as if I was supposed to check that the order was correct at the door. When they finally agreed to do something about it, their offer was to give me a "$1 credit for the next time I came in" as that was the price difference of the Pad Thai with Tofu vs. without Tofu.

I was incredibly frustrated that they had made a mistake, and they weren't willing to do anything to correct it. Either delivery me what I ordered, or don't charge me for what you delivered (that was incorrect)!

At the end, we reached out to Seamless who contacted the restaurant (who still refused to do anything about it). Because Seamless is so awesome, they credited us half the price of the messed up item - which we appreciated.

In the end, it wasn't about the money, but rather the principle. We've been customers for almost half a decade and you made a mistake - so fix it! And since they didn't, it may have cost them not only our future business, but our recommendation for friends looking for a good Thai spot in SF...
author: Celine v.

description:
We were the ONLY people in the restaurant but it took them a full 40 minutes to bring out the first dish, then the soup came out 20 minutes after that and another 20 minutes before the final two dishes came out.  Understandable if they were busy but we were the only people in this place.  Thai food is not that hard to make and is fairly quick.  

They also brought water but put it on the table next to us and wouldn't give it to us till after we ordered.  

The food itself was OK, nothing special.
author: reza n.

description: This place is the best thai food in the city! I had the crispy Benjarong noodles, green curry, brown rice, papaya salad, and coconut soup. One was not better than the other, they were all so freakin good! Our server Fa was so sweet and attentive. We told her of our planned summer trip to Thailand and she had some pointers for us. Well def be back here, no doubt about it.
author: Monique Q.

description: Food is better than your typical American Thai, but called in an order through Yelp that never got entered into their system and food was over 2 hours late. I had to call them and they blamed it on "the new delivery guy." Didn't offer to throw in anything or reduce the order. :( I would beware of the cucumber salad which appears to be a couple of cucumbers soaked in what looks like bright red oil. Really gross.
author: Chris J.

description: Had some good food here today, fresh & hot. Was concerned about weirdness of street, Lombard is sort of a fly by night artery and it could be easy to miss this place. My pal and I had 2 nice veggie entrees, made to order and really good. Portions could be larger is my only gripe.
author: Henry K.

description: I enjoyd the lunch very much!the prices are not the best and it took then a while to make the food even though i was the only one there but the beef bbq was great!!!! Very good service
author: Zohar I.

description:
We ordered through EAT24 which is now owned by YELP.

After an hour and a half we called and they couldn't find our order.

Then they called back and said they didn't realize it was for delivery! 

EAT24 is horrible, Benjarong Thai Cuisine is horrible.
author: Becky C.

description:
I come here for lunch all the time.  The lunch combination is huge, delicious and potentially healthy.  The woman who works at the front is extremely nice and helpful.

 -The benjarong fresh roll with prawns are great.  The peanut sauce is not my favorite, but it is still good.
 -The green curry is standard but also very good.  Lots of fresh veggies and real prawns.  No baby shrimp pawned off as prawns.
 -The pad see eww is standard and good as well.
author: Courtney C.

description:
I normally came here about twice a month when I lived nearby.

I think they would get much more business if they were on Union or Chestnut, but I appreciated having the place to myself so often.

The food was just about right for the price, and being a 2 block walk away. With enough begging, they would make my food spicy enough.
author: Jason W.

description: The best Thai food in the marina / cow hollow area. Definitely a better option than Osha. The spring rolls are soft and come with a nice thick sauce. The banana blossom salad is crunchy and flavorful. The grilled trout has a wonderful savory taste. Great option for a low key dinner. You can always get seated right away.
author: Julie N.

description: This place is very underrated. The pumpkin curry is incredible, the chicken satay is perfect, in fact, all the chicken dishes are great, and the eggplant is fantastic. It's legit thai food and thai food is amazing. It's also pretty damn cheap for SF.
author: Michael G.

description:
Delivery review:

Delivery was on time and overall the food was good.

The thai fried rice was tasty, the Tom Ka Gai was a bit thick thick but flavorful, and the Jungle curry was interesting but more like a soup if you ask me and not my favorite.
author: Christopher Steven O.

description:
Sorry I have no raves for this restaurant.  Maybe it was an off night... The setting was charming but the service was very slow. It was hard to understand since there was only one other occupied table for some of the time our small group was there. 

When the tea arrived, it was lukewarm. The sweet sauce for the dish did not show up with the food, and I had to ask for it. The waitress did not seem to be familiar with the menu.

Yes, everything was fresh and they gladly served brown rice, but I can't say this was much of a dining experience.
author: Lynn S.

description:
My experience here started off with a big misunderstanding. My friend and I walked in with a very large group of people that were around our age so it seemed like we were with that group. The group all went to the back, but we were waiting by the front to be seated. There were 2 ladies setting tables. They both saw us, and made eye contact a few times, but never came over to seat us. I waited for another 5 minutes until finally walking up to one of the ladies and asking if we should sit wherever we would like. She kindly apologized and seated us immediately, saying she thought we were with the other group, but waiting on a few more people at the front.

Once we were seated, I wasn't frustrated anymore, and the rest of my experience was fantastic. The lady that waited our table (same lady that seated us) was so pleasant and polite. Everytime we complimented our food or thanked them for something, we were presented with a "Thank You" back and a small bow/nod of the head. So kind! My friend and I ordered our food. The food arrived in a very timely fashion, which was 

I got a spicy noodle dish, and it was absolutely amazing. I have a weak stomach, and usually have stomach aches after eating really spicy food, but this was completely satisfying. No stomach aches afterward, and I ate pretty much my entire plate! I can't wait to go back to this place.
author: Ashley D.

description:
When I called for delivery asked if there was charger lady says no but you have to tip the driver...since when do you "have to" tip anyone? Tips are given based on service.
We ordered Tom yum soup which was delicious but only had 4 shrimp in a large. The Pad Thai was disappointing, came only 3/4 full, lots of bean sprouts, no peanuts or cilantro and the noodles were very thin rice noodles and a bit dry and the chicken was over cooked. Will try a different place next time where my option to tip is my own.
author: Victoria R.

description: DO NOT EAT HERE!  I got horrible food poisoning when I went and had to go to the hospital.  I called and emailed management and couldn't even get them to respond to me!  It was a horrible experience, and I will never, ever go there again!
author: Mis W.

description:
This place is a joke. Ordered delivery and it took 2.5 hours to arrive and let me tell you, not worth the bloody wait.  

There are many other options in the neighborhood and I highly recommend that you seek them out. 

STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE. 

Oh and they forgot the rice.
author: Keith J.

description:
I should say upfront that the lower rating is not for the food, but for the service.

The service is EXTREMELY slow. My office staff (about 13 people) went here for a holiday lunch yesterday. We got there about 12:15 and didn't leave until 2:15, not by choice, but because of how late we got our drinks and our food. And most of us ordered the lunch specials and we were the only customers there!! It seemed like they had one person in the kitchen and one person manning the tables. TOTAL. It took 20 minutes to even get our water. 

That being said, the food was delicious.

I had their lunch special for about $10, which included:
- Veggie Soup - kind of bland, texture was a bit gooey. 
- Fresh Soft Rolls with Tofu - Yummy, filling, healthy, served with a delicious peanut sauce. 
- Green Curry with plenty of veggies and tofu, served with brown rice: This was super delicious! Taste was exquisite. 

I also tasted my colleague's Asian Eggplant Dish --  and I couldn't keep from dipping into his plate over and over again. YUMMY.

Overall, if they hired some more wait staff and kitchen staff, and could serve a lunch in 40 minutes start to finish, they would be getting a lot more business than the do right now. Step up your game Benjarong! You're selling yourself short!
author: Krithika H.

description:
Benjarong Thai is literally one of the greatest places I have ever stumbled into on accident in my life. 

So, it's Easter (so a handful of places are closed), it's raining really hard (so walking around isn't much of an option), and Wondercon is in town (so there are comic book kids filling every restaurant in SOMA, making wait times impossible). What do you do?

Well, first off, after leaving Wondercon (where I found out how terrifyingly intimidating Lou Ferrigno really is.. he is a scary man) my Papa and I went into Jollibee (which I reviewed after last Wondercon, actually. Aw, nostalgia...). Jollibee was packed wall to wall with boys discussing Iron Man and Proactiv. LITERALLY.

So, we ran away and hid in the car (I was dressed as a sassy Lara Croft, so, if you can imagine, it was tiny black shorts and a tiny black tank with heels, which is not exactly the best rainy day outfit). We drove around and ended up on Lombard and it was raining way too hard to go venturing too much, so we saw 'THAI' on a window and decided it was acceptable.

Um, acceptable is the understatement of the year. Try amazing.  

First off, the decor is absolutely the cutest thing in the world. It is small, there's flowers,and not cheesy, but authentic feeling. The space is small,but not cramped. Its effing adorable.

The place was completely empty. Well, it was about three on a Sunday, and it was Easter Sunday, and it was raining like crazy, so basically it makes it so it wouldn't be too busy anyways. We walked in and a waitress popped out of nowhere and gave us a table and some iced water. The menu is decently extensive, with the standards (Pad Thai, Satay,Curry, etc) along with some surprises (Three Fish Taste plate, NY Steak?!).  

We started with the Crispy Wonton (pictured, check it).  It came with a raspberry-vinegar sauce (we think) and it was well excecuted. Not oily or fatty tasting at all, and a good consistancy.  It came in a cute little basket over a bed of wonton crisps.  

I got the chicken Pad Thai (I was way too hungry to think, and just wanted my favorite) and I talked my dad into trying the Choo Chee Avacado Prawns (because I wanted to know what that meant). 

Um, YES YES YES. Pad Thai is the greatest food, and this place does it up right.  It was the perfect consistancy, the perfect proportions of noodles, egg, meat, etc, and was cooked to perfection.

According to my dad (um, who did not share his Choo Chee Avacado Prawns), his was 'excellent'.  He said that the shrimp, which could very easily have gone wrong, were cooked to perfction and the texture of the sauce was excellent.  Note: this dish seemed hard to describe, which is why we had to order it to figure out what it was, but to get a sneak peak, I posted a picture of it. Also, get it with a side of rice.

It  was absolutely adorable, excellent quality, and an amazing place.
author: Andrea C.

description:
So I get take out here A LOT since I work in the neighborhood, and it's mostly been fine. I always order the lunch special, which gives you a lot for what you pay for. The food is good, the staff is nice, but their timing--terrible. 

I am almost always the only person there when I go to pick up my order and even if it's been 30-40 minutes since I ordered it I am usually sitting around for at least another 10 minutes waiting for it to be ready. I understand that perhaps other people are ordering takeout around lunch time, but with an entirely empty restaurant this seems a bit absurd. Even more absurd considering that today I hear a microwave buzzing from the back which should account for shorter cooking times if you're nuking parts of my lunch. 

I also do not eat meat or dairy, and while they have a sizable list of options for vegetarians, a few times now I have walked back to my office with beef or chicken and only realized the mistake once it was too late for me to go back. 

With all that said, I do like their food and I will stay a patron, but it seems someone in the kitchen is in la-la land.
author: Natalie R.

description: Just moved to SF and went with Benjarong because it was so highly rated. Ordered some spring rolls, green curry and pad see ew via the Eat24 app and unfortunately, the order was 45 minutes later than we were promised. The driver had three orders in his car (in addition to mine), which means that with each stop, every one of those orders were getting held up. Our spring rolls were cold and soggy by the time we got them. The noodles and curry were delicious but luke warm at best. I might eat in the restaurant, but I don't think I'd trust them to delivery the food in a timely manner.
author: Cory O.

description: I've been here twice and each time the food was fantastic! I look forward to returning soon!
author: Brett F.

description: Slow service and below-average food. That said, the curry was OK.
author: Firas A.

description:
Mango tofu red curry lunch combo with fresh roll and brown rice was delicious. This was one of the most delicious thai curries I've had, just the right spicyness. The brown rice was the good true brown rice, and the fresh roll was awesome. What an amazing lunch combo. Definitely will be back, probably to order the exact same thing again.

BBQ chicken was good, though dark meat.
author: L B.

description: I heard about this from the KQED show Check Please and decided to take my wife and try it out while in the city. The place does not have dedicated parking so you are in the mercy of street parking. We ended up parking 3 blocks away which was ok as we needed to walk off all the food we ate.  We ordered from the chefs recommendation page of the menu: Crispy pork, Mango chicken curry and Thai surprise. The latter is a sweet pad Thai like noodle wrapped in an egg crepe. Everything was very good. The curry has just the right amount of heat balanced with the sweetness of ripe yellow mangoes. The crispy pork was a good and a nice departure from the common Thai dishes I normally get.  Will surely go back here when in the area.
author: Benjo S.

description: As a first time caterer for our staff lunch they were just fantastic. They accommodated many food alleriges/preferences. Highly recommended.
author: Danielle M.

description:
Awesome presentation of food!
Littlebit more expensive than expected... But who cares...we were damn hungry... And probably made wise choice
author: Mayuresh H.

description:
Excellent food and service.

 We had
Chicken satay-wonderful, moist, flavorful pad thai-as good as our favorite, excellent well prepared
Rad nah with shrimp and chicken-best we have ever had.
Pineapple Shrimp fried rice-a real treat made with raisins which is a lot better that it sounds.
Garlic pepper chicken-good flavor but not as spicy as I like.
Desserts are also wonderful. We cold not decide, so we got one of each. The mango Bomba was the consensus favorite, but I preferred the lemonchella. The Thai custard is also great and there was one vote for the snowball. You simply cannot go wrong. If you like Thai, this is a good one.



I
author: TwoGirlsDad S.

description:
Coconut rice with strips of coconut in it!  Delicious.  

Curry had plenty of basil and not over-flavored with bell peppers.  

I'll be back!
author: liz s.

description:
There is nothing more irritating than a long wait for mediocre food. OK, maybe there are more irritating things in this world, but when you are sitting around your house at 8:45 pm, waiting for your delivery to show up over 30 minutes later than anticipated, little else seems to matter. 

And when you call twice to complain and are essentially told, "It is on its way. Deal with it," your frustration can mount. 

And when the food shows up cold and lackluster in taste, you feel pangs of regret that you didn't just go pick up something else, all the while shoveling food in your mouth to quiet your rumbling stomach.

And when this is the third time in a row that this has happened to you with this restaurant, you realize that there is no one to blame but yourself for bothering to order from the same terrible place once again.
author: Teal C.

description:
Just left this place! We're visiting the city from Canada and just discovered this little gem across the street from our hotel. We started with the crispy spring rolls with a spicy peanut sauce.. delicious! I got the spicy pan fried chicken dish and my boyfriend got the bbq'd beef. The chicken in my dish and his beef were soo tender and juicy! Mine was extremely spicy and that's how I like it! I find most places don't make it spicy enough but I was sweating! Needless to say we thoroughly enjoyed it and both meals came to only $30. We will probably go back before we leave! 

The ONLY annoying thing about this place is the music! But the food is more than worth dealing with that haha
author: Justeen M.

description:
I love Thai food, so when I come across a Thai restaurant that I do not like, I get sad. *insert sad face here*

They were very nice when I stepped in so I'll bump it up a star, however the food did not have that "X factor" to make my mouth dance. The Asian decor was the most authentic thing there, as the food itself just didn't taste authentic to me. Maybe the chef was having a bad day and decided to take it out on my food.

I've ordered Pad Thai a million times elsewhere and have never had a bad experience. How do you mess up Pad Thai, the most common of dishes? Benjarong's version was dry, bland, and lacked flavor. Pad Thai? More like Bad Thai. 

And the prices are on the medium-high side. Even if prices were lower, I don't think I could lower my standards regarding food quality, but I've had way better Thai food elsewhere and can't really justify paying to eat here.

Will I be back? Nope.
author: Joraine C.

description: Food is awesome but the 2 Thai ladies are always talking shit. Especially when you ask for something. Bad customer service I'd say no tip!
author: Kay O.

description:
The food here is solid and yummy. 

The green curry was on point. The pad see ew was quite a but small portion size for the price. 

Overall solid place if you're in the mood for Thai in the Marina area.
author: Jade W.

description:
I was looking for a change from Osha on Union. Well I suppose I found one.

To begin with, Benjarong can't really be compared with Osha. Benjarong is small, a more mom and pop place and there's only one waitress. They also have a "honeymoon" table... which I have never in my life seen before. Cute... but probably not practical.

There were also minute differences in the things I usually order. Benjarong's Pad Thai comes with huge shrimp complete with big tails and they sell coconut ice cream by itself (which they nicely packed in tin foil). Which would have been fabulous, had they not smothered it in chocolate sauce. It was really more of a sundae truthfully.

Taste wise they also can not compare. Benjarong's Pad Thai has a very strange smell/ taste to it. I'd call it ketchupy. Since I usually cannot stop myself from eating the whole Pad Thai plate within an hour, the fact I set it aside and wasn't interested totally makes up my mind for me.

Cute place, but the food just isn't up to snuff. Sorry Ben.
author: Meg T.

description:
It's sort of a shame, because the food was actually quite good when it FINALLY came, but we'll never go through the nightmare of ordering delivery from here again. 

I ordered delivery through Foodler. After an hour and no food, I called to check on the status of our order. She assured me it was "on the way." But, I'm pretty sure this is when she actually put the order in. 

45 minutes later (1 hour and 45 minutes after placing the original order), I called back. Again, I was assured that my order was "on the way." When I mentioned that this is what she said 45 minutes ago, she proceeded to tell me that it was slow because it was raining. But I live 3.5 blocks from the restaurant so even in a torrential downpour, it wouldn't take 45 minutes for them to get to my place from there. I can't stand the "on its way" lie... 

The Red Curry and Beef with Broccoli were good. But I can't handle a 2 hour wait, especially when Yukol Thai is so good and fast.
author: Christa S.

description: We were staying at a nearby hotel and decided to try this place out. Went with the old pad Thai and green curry standbys, and were glad we did. With a side of rice and some delicious Thai iced teas, we were full and very happy. Service was fast and friendly, I would definitely try again!
author: Stephanie G.

description:
I stumbled upon this place with a friend when we were in the mood for Thai.  I expected the worst and was pleasantly surprised.  The place is decorated nicely and a large selection to chose from.  The biggest negative was that service was very slow.  There was only one waitress but there were only a few tables (like 3) occupied by small groups of 2.  I ordered Tom Yum soup with prawns and my friend got a salmon salad to start.  The salad came out after a little while but we just sat there and waiting for a while for the soup.  When the soup finally came it was actually very good and worth the wait.  My friend loved her salmon salad.  We shared the jungle curry which doesn't have coconut so it was nice and light.  We ended the night on mango sticky rice which was lovely and I had a coconut to drink.

Summary: Good food but slow service.
author: Madeline W.

description:
OVERALL: 4.3

FOOD: 4
SERVICE: 5
AMBIANCE: 4
VALUE: 4

Ikea never looked or tasted so good, cozy or Thai!  Playful & demure service matches the warm,  unassuming décor & was perfect for a small group in search of hot food on a blustery evening.

About 50% full at 8pm, so either we missed the dinner rush, or the dinner rush is missing a whole lotta yummy Thai!  Menu is nicely diverse, with standard options for tofu/pork/chicken/beef/prawns in each dish.  Went family-style and left rosy-cheeked, full, and energized for a night out.

*Tofu Tom Kha Soup (L): Perfect for 4, good fragrant coconut, but a bit sweet for me.  ALMOST lukewarm.

*Thai Hot Basil Pork: Crisp green beans were fantastic with just enough heat & tons of basil; pork was crisp/tender, as if grilled.

*Chicken Pad See Ew: DIVINE.  Veggie/Meat:Noodles = 1:1, which was AWESOME...Great balance of savory-sweet.

*Asian Otak: Never seen this anywhere else, and though I still don't know exactly what was in it, I recommend trying it.  Yummy, saucy mix of catfish, shrimp, cabbage, & thick coconut curry all wrapped in lovely banana leaves & grilled.  Not unlike a saucy Thai tamale and/or laulau--rewarding change of pace from more standard curries.

Total: $15.50 (tax & tip included) / person (happily split the bill on 4 cards--bonus!)

I'll be back!
author: Amy K.

description:
Ok, so we are admittedly Thai food snobs, and we are both former pro chefs. That said, this was by far the worst example of Thai food we've yet to experience in America.

Since when do you thicken Tom ka gai with corn starch? The answer is, YOU DON'T! We were appalled by this gloppy and gluey version of a classic soup, so disappointed. Apparently the chef thickens all of their sauces too, when we received our Green curry dish it was obvious by it's "jiggly wave motion" that it too had been thickened inappropriately with corn starch.

The calamari appetizer was cold beyond belief, and way too thinly cut to remain warm if served immediately.

The shrimp spring roll was one shrimp wrapped like a cigar and then fried to hell, WTF?!

The soft shell crab and green mango salad was also executed poorly, the dressing was so sour it made my eyeballs squinty for an hour, although the actual crab part was prepared fine.

When we asked if we could have the brown rice and the white jasmine rice, our female server shook her head "no", WTF? No? Really? We were the only table in the establishment, "no", really?

The grimy vinyl place mats were just that, sticky and very unappealing, they reminded me of similar placemats my grandma used in the 70's; not good!
 
Dead plants in the front of the venue should've been our first clue, this is NEVER a good sign of what's to be served and how an eatery is run.

We're going to give Marnee Thai a try tomorrow night, hopefully with some success.
author: Kevin W.

description: Great food and service, and nicely decorated. My daughter loved the straw wrappers that they turn into a cute little flower atop your straw. We'd love to go back next time we are in the city.
author: J J.

description:
So - I've eaten here several times now.

My go to is the Pumpkin Curry with coconut rice and I would give that alone 5 stars... hands down BEST thing on the menu - SUPER YUMMY!!!!!!!

But everything else I've tried have left me disappointed. We always try to order Salads to have a few veggies in the meal and so far ... NOT great :( 

The first time (Silver Noodle Salad) we asked for no Prawns in the salad (which the menu called for) and when we got it you could CLEARLY taste they had just removed them with a fork or something, because the lettuce tasted EXTREMELY Prawn-y and therefor uneatable in my opinion. 

Second time (Beef Artichoke Salad) MINT OVERLOAD - lighten it up already!

Seems like this is a place to go to for their curry and ONLY their curry (and the pumpkin curry at that!)
author: Alison M.

description:
+1 for brown rice!  woo hoo!  Everything was so flavorful and delicious!  Go for the Tom Kha soup, Thai Hot Basil, Vegetarian Delight, and Asian Eggplant.  You can't go wrong!
So happy that they were open late on a Tuesday night.
author: Laura G.

description:
I always wonder why some reviews are "Stellar" and others are less than positive. How could I have such a "Meh" experience and the Yelper before and/or after me have such a positive one? I simply don't understand how such reviews can be so inconsistent across the board...

Anywho, feeling rather lazy, the boyfriend and I decided to get some Thai food delivered. Although we're both very much in love with Yokol Thai- we decided we wanted to try something new. (Yokol- I'm sorry I cheated on you. Take me back! Take me back! What a fool I've been!)

TANGENT: We ordered via GrubHub- and I must say- I like this service! I especially like the nude male cartoon that pops up on my screen after I place my order. (Yes- we did e-mail GrubHub about their Rated R image. They told us the graphic was open to interpretation and to enjoy our meal...We had a lot of fun with the interpretation part. :)

We ordered:

Pad See-Ew (Yummy, but I've had better)
3 other dishes that might as well remain nameless because their really isn't much to say.

The food came cold AFTER WAITING FOR AN HOUR AND A HALF. They totally forgot our order- what other explanation is there? (Maybe they were serving all the people that rated this place 4 and 5 star.) 

That being said, I can't be that upset with this place. I mean, they told us beforehand that they were the RONG (Wrong) place to go. Next time, I'll listen. Wait, wait that's not right. They're won't be a next time.
author: Annalise F.

description:
The food was actually not bad and the service was also alright. The bizarre thing is that either the utensil or the floor has a strong detergent smell/taste. Even after leaving, I still had the bad taste in my mouth. 

Also the waitress didn't ask me how spicy I'd like for my dish like many other Thai restaurants do and resulted in the curry dish too spicy for me to have.
author: X L.

description: The food is really good, standing out from other Thai restaurants in the City, and the prices are consistent with Thai food places in the area. The dining area is ver well-decorated, and overall I enjoyed my dining experience here. I'd like to rate this nice, little restaurant higher, but the experience was really damaged by the bizarrely bad service.  There was only one server working, and although there was only one other table of  customers needing service, we could not get our waitress to pay attention to us.  When we asked to order, we were repeatedly told "in a few minutes", and then the staff wandered off, visibly not busy.  As this could have been a one-time event and the food was so good, I'm inclined to give them the benefit of the doubt.
author: Sam G.

description:
Showed up here on a Monday night, the place was deserted... as in 0 patrons. Five of us walked in and were seated by a very nice man who was obviously related to the family who owns the place. Noticed right away that a small collection of prepared to-go orders were waiting on the bar for either pick-up or delivery. The smell of fresh basil frying was in the air... the very cold air. So cold, our host was bundled up in a heavy pea coat and scarf. Not that surprising since it was snowing on Russian Hill the night before (not enough to stick, but snowing none the less). 

The small space that Benjarong occupies is a long and narrow void filled with all kinds of Thai (and Chinese) art knick-knacks and artwork.. The room is dimly lit away from the riser bar area. We had some issues reading the menus, but that was easily overcome. 

We ordered up a chicken laarb to start. It was nicely done, but this type of dish is supposed to be served cold - it came out really warm probably due to the chicken not being readily prepared to serve, so they cooked more. Not too appetizing when you are expecting a cool protein laden salad. 

As mains, we decided to have the red and green curry each prepared with chicken. Our sides were brown and white pearl rice. Also, we ordered Thai Hot Basil with pork and the classic Phad Thai noodle dish. 

All of the mains were very well prepared and it was nice to have three options for rice (pearl, sticky and brown). Unlike many other Thai restaurants, their curries are definitely distinct between them. 

The green curry had a real smoothness to it that crept up on you on the finish providing a feeling of "I want more of that silky heat" as the next bite was anticipated. The red curry was a bit bolder up front, but somehow they were able to provide the exact opposite effect as the green - it stood up in your face and stayed there. That's a good character facet that's sometimes either overlooked or over presented by most Thai cooks. 

The Thai Hot Basil Pork was a simple preparation that packed a lot of flavor. Unlike most other Thai restaurants, this version was much less oily and salty than usual. I later found out that they use no MSG in any of their dishes - good to know. 

Now here's the reason for a middle of the road rating - the place was like a meat packing house. The heater must have either been broken or not turned on at all. This left for an uncomfortable experience overall - well that and the $2-$3 each higher prices for the same dishes at other Thai restaurants in the area... and $4-$6 more than the Thai restaurants in the LA area. 

The carved and dyed daikon radish decroumontes we a nice touch on the appetizer plates, but quickly became annoying when they came on EVERY dish. Show your diversity, mix it up with other plate decorations... please.

The service was spot on, just as a good Thai Restaurant should have.
author: Leet M.

description: Did you know that they deliver?  I love their food and their service.  Can't say enough good things.  Eat healthy and give yourself a break from Pizza once in a while!
author: Harry M.

description: We ordered Tom Yum soup and some ginger chicken to go for a late night snack. It's terrible. I've never seen onions and cabbage in Tom Yum. It's overly sweet. The fish sauce made our place stink! I love Thai good. I eat it at least once a week. This was my worst experience in a long time!
author: Danielle W.

description:
Welcome to the Jungle. Not the terrible and terribly overplayed '80s song, but the Jungle curry at Benjarong. Tofu, green peas, carrots, zucchini, pumpkin, potatoes, basil and pepper. Portion is generous, the broth is clear without even a hint of grease and oil, and everything tastes super healthy and super delicious. It's one of the best curries I've ever had.

You can't play this one enough.
author: Jason B.

description: besides having a crazy name, this place also has some pretty good food that I usually come to for delivery.  i like that everything comes in a neatly packaged container, maybe not the most carbon friendly, but maybe im just a sucker for presentation.  The soups I have to admit are a bit on the salty side, but the salads are all dope, salmon, larb, etc. also the pad see yue (spelling), with seafood option is rad, it's got like mussels, shrimp, salmon, squid all in it.
author: christopher h.

description:
Wednesday, 10:15PM.

The folks here were nice enough to accommodate the five of us so late in the eve. They close at 10:30PM, so props to them for being so nice. 

+Nice decor, ritzy and bourgie feel without the pretention
+Friendly staff, awesome service (responsive to refills)
+Quick turnaround without decrease in food quality

Stuffed my face in:
1. Spring rolls, vegan
     +Fresh, fresh minty bites of tofu and noodles
2. Benjarong Veggie Delight
     +Firm string beans/asparagus/carrots and savory tofu
     +Broth was delish - how'd they do this without pouring grease!?
3. Brown rice
     +Generous scoop

Final Call:
With so many Thai places in the area, Benjarong distinguishes itself by providing friendly n' good service, having appealing decor, and serving yumm-li-cious food.
author: Chuck N.

description:
First, I just want to mention one thing that scored major points with me: the food is spicy if it is labeled as such on the menu. Most of the time when I go somewhere and order something spicy, it's still fairly mild. Not so with Benjarong.

The service was prompt and friendly-- they were attentive, yet I never felt rushed. I was really indecisive and it took me a while to decide because there were so many great options. I ended up ordering the soft shell crab appetizer, and the spicy lamb (one of the night's specials) as a main dish.

The first thing that struck me was the food presentation. Everything was pleasing to look at, and it really makes the place feel much fancier.

The soft shell crab (appetizer) is breaded in a lightly-seasoned breading and deep-fried. The breading was delicious and crispy, but the crab seemed sub-par. I had to pick my way through it, but the breading, combined with the Thai dipping sauce (a lighter version of the sweet chili sauce plus peanuts on top) almost makes up for it, though. Ultimately, I would probably recommend a different appetizer, though.

The spicy lamb dish was fantastic. It had just the right amount of heat without being overwhelming. Definitely get some rice to go along with this. The lamb wasn't overcooked, and the vegetables (red and green peppers, onions, ginger, and some large vegetable I wasn't able to identify) were all cooked just right. The portions were also just right, and if you don't have a particularly large appetite, there should be some leftovers to take with you.

I had plenty to eat and enjoyed my time there. All in all, this was a good visit.
author: Alex K.

description: I've tried a lot of Pad Thai, and this was some great Pad Thai. A+! I recommend and will return.
author: Jeff B.

description:
I have pretty strict standards for Thai, since that's my favorite food. Benjarong has pretty good flavors. Unfortunately for me, the flavors are very Americanized. Every dish we ordered were on the sweet side to extremely sweet. It didn't leave much exotic flavor I have come to enjoy in typical thai affair. 
The only above average dish I had was the pork larb. This is a rare dish in thai restaurants and they made it well. The lime juice was perfectly portioned to bring up that exotic flavor. This would be your best feel good salad excuse.
author: Jeff K.

description: Great Thai restaurant.  Friendly staff and great place for lunch.  I had the pumpkin curry which had just enough burn to make it interesting.  My wife had the softshell crab pad Thai and it was wonderful.  I highly recommend.
author: Neil C.

description: Thai :) I got the pumpkin curry was really delicious and spicy. My bf got the spicy pan fried noodles good as well and very spicy! ( at least for me) On the downside, my only complaint was the slow service and there was only one other couple in the restaurant.
author: Megan S.

description: Wow, this has got to be the best thai I've ever had. I admit, I am not thai and not a thai food specialist, but I can appreciate good seasoning. We ordered the pumpkin curry which I was very hesitant too... was it going to be sweet? salty? what the hell is pumpkin curry? Anyway, it was creamy, spicy with chunks of acorn squash and chicken. my husband had the  silver city noodle soup which was light and tasty with light thin noodles in a seafood broth. The service was pleasant and attentive. I am so sad I live in So. Cal as this was so tasty. When can I come back???
author: Milka C.

description:
My fiancée and I are thai snobs and this is the place we go to get our fix. The pineapple fried rice is over-the-top yummy as are the crispy spring rolls.  We also enjoy the potato yellow curry and of course the pad thai is a classic. 

I have to prevent myself from ordering here more than once a week.
author: Pete F.

description: I ordered food to be delivered for a dinner party (there were 5 of us) and it was fantastic.  Everything came on time and was delivered hot and well packaged.  We ordered:  Standouts were the fresh rolls with shrimp, ginger chicken and jungle curry.  Will definitely do this again in the future!
author: Peggy F.

description:
I had not been here for along time, because of the last experience was not so good.
I went back because my client had order foods here for her private Singing Bowls  group session, and I like the foods.
My friend and I went to this place last week, I really enjoyed the foods and the surrounding with nice soothing decor. 
The new owner is very nice and friendly, the person who serving us he is very polite and nice too.
author: Kim L.

description: A cute little place with terrific food and very nice service!
author: Chris H.

description:
Reeeaaally good thai curry!! 

I usually come here for lunch to-go on days that I feel like splurging a bit and they have an amazing lunch combination. Appetizer + soup of the day + meal = $8.95 if you order chicken, pork or beef! Amazing!! I usually get the Benjarong Fresh Rolls for the appetizer b/c the peanut sauce is delicious and it feels more healthy but they have spring rolls and samosas on the menu as well. 

The curries, I've tried yellow and green, are so delicious and they give you a pretty generous helping as well. Usually I'll only eat like half of the liquid, take it home, add some water and corn starch, throw in some potatoes and shrimp and I've tripled my meal!! Don't laugh... you know that in these times of recession it's a genius way to push a meal!

Wouldn't recommend the cashew dish - not enough cashews!!
author: Christina L.

description: Quick Delivery, delicious food. I've had thai food from several places around San Francisco and this place has the best Pad Thai and Yellow Curry I've tasted around the city. I doubt you'll be disappointed!
author: Mandy R.

description:
Sometimes when Cody and I don't want to cook, which happens often after being up all day, working like someone has a fire under your ass, and just wanting hot food, we use everyones best friend Yelp! on the iPhone app and pick something new and local to try.

This led us to Benjarong, which is so close to us, that we could literally spit on it. But of course we didn't, because it was awesome. 

I'm a sucker for traditional thai, although I do love some thai fusion every once and a while. Giving orders to a singing waitress (literally she sang everytime she brought food, very cute) we waited to be fed with spicy basil chicken, tom yum sour soup, eggplant tofu, and fresh rolls.

Their portions are generous, which is important, because the two of us eat, and we eat a lot. The eggplant was perfectly done, and the tofu lightly battered before being soaked in delicious spicy black bean sauce. Cody loved the tom yum soup, and the broth was wonderfully rich and had a nice aftertaste to it. The only thing that ever freaks me out are those "penis" mushroom. You all know what I'm talking about here. I'm a big mushroom fan, but those always seem a little lacking in flavor, but their suggestive shape still makes me laugh whenever I see them.

The service was prompt and thoughtful, their space is cute, and it's not really expensive. We ate like kings are queens and our bills was less than 50 bucks with tax and tip. It feels like a homerun restaurant where the food is fresh, and I love that. Plus they have that killer coconut sticky rice with mango dessert which is so worth the calories to me.
author: Danielle S.

description: Got take out here based on a friend's recommendation and was a bit disappointed. The pad thai had very little chicken (plenty of tofu) and the salmon rolls, while pretty good, were very thin and not much for $7.50. I haven't been able to find any better Thai in the area but this isn't somewhere I'm rushing back to.
author: Robbie K.

description:
Is it me or do Lombard St. have a Thai place every other block? My friends and I were in hunt for a dinner near Fort Mason. We were without a car and didn't want to walk 30 minutes for a dinner and walk back - we've just spend entire day biking around San Francisco and Golden Gate Bridge and not in mood for another long manual transportation.

Seriously, we walked about 20 minutes and found at least 4 different Thai cuisines and didn't know where to go. This place won it because we gave up walking around and this place happened to located when we gave up. The place wasn't too crowded - sign saying the place is bad. However, it wasn't all that bad.

My friend got the classic default Basil Fried Rice. Lame. I was feeling some fried rice too but then got sizzling beef because this was chef's suggestion and must be really good if he suggests it.

The poor entree don't even come with a bowl of rice. I had to order it separately - costing me precious $2. Lame. However, the sizzling beef was great choice. It was very spicy - not sure why... but had a bold flavor and enough portion.

I don't know if I can recommend this place though. There are other Thai places nearby and they may be better than this place. We didn't try, so I can't say much. However, this place is cozy and well-priced.
author: Josh S.

description: Delicious dishes - especially the pumpkin curry. Great service.  Also good were the pad thai and spicy string beans.
author: Lee S.

description: Pad See Yew was very delicious.  Good atmosphere and service.  Prices are very reasonable.
author: David P.

description: I don't have any complaints about the taste of food itself but it isn't anything impressive.  However, I've paid less for more elsewhere.  I only ordered a tasty Pad-See-Ew (w/ shrimp: $11.95) here, but it costed me $15 total with tax & tip.  At King of Thai (in North Beach), it would only cost me $5+tax+tip and they gave me more food.
author: Wendy T.

description:
Since my last post the ownership has changed, and it is evident. 

Good news: Food is good. Not anything super special compared to what I remember. 

Bad news: Benjarong went from a lovely Thai restaurant to a place for Thai takeout. During our dinner, the server (who was the only person manning the phones and restaurant) left while taking our order 2x to answer the phone for takeout orders. So sad, cause we loved the place so much.
author: Andi B.

description:
When you're tired of paying for the fancy and over priced Thai places (aka Osha) and don't mind a mom and pop shop, which is equally as good in taste, this place is GREAT!  It's a very cute and charming little restaurant and the staff is very attentive and nice.  Everything was well priced. Between two persons of 5'1 and 6'1(weighing in about 275 lbs), we had:

*Calamari (It's a thing to MUST order at every restaurant - looking for the best calamari ever!): The texture of the batter was a bit crunchier than what we were use to.  It wasn't bad, but it wasn't OMG either. It was accompanied by a sweet and sour sauce, i prefer an aioli or creamy sauce with my calamari. 

*Duck Red Curry:  This is one of the best curries I've had.  It was very rich and velvety, probably from the duck (I agree with Brooke C - could have used a bit more duck meat instead of skin).  Other than that, it was tasty.
