*Scallops & Asparagus: I love both scallops and asparagus, so having the two together made me SUPER HAPPY! It was a really good dish, it was a tad saucy but eating it with the rice helped balance that out. If you're not a big onion fan, they do use a lot of it in this dish. 

Happy to say we were very satisfied with the meal and did not leave hungry or super bloated.  It's a nice 5 minute walk from where we were and i liked walking home to help digest the meal :)

Pros:
- Decently Priced ($40 / two) 
- Yummy food, would recommend to someone if they are near by
- Proportions are perfect

Cons:
- Small space
- Probably not good for a large party
- Side rice portions are a bit on the small end though (not enough for a 6'1 rice eating guy)

Recommendations:
- Don't bother with parking, it's hard especially in the Marina.  Go for a nice walk, it's good for ya! :)
author: Kathy D.

description:
The pumpkin curry is the best dish I have found at a Thai restaurant in SF!! I order it every time I eat here. DELICIOUS. You must order the pumpkin curry!

The fresh roll is also wonderful.  

The atmosphere is extremely relaxing and spa-like.

This is not your typical Thai restaurant.  The food is beautifully prepared and comes out looking like art.  Everything tastes very fresh and clean, and you don't leave feeling like you have a rock in your stomach.

The only problem is service is extremely slow.  We usually wait for our food FOREVER.  If you don't mind having a long, leisurely meal, the wonderful atmosphere makes it a great spot. If you're hungry and in a hurry, go for take-out.
author: Alexis L.

description: I was very happy with my experience at Benjarong. Cozy atmosphere, attentive and friendly staff & tasty food. I had chicken satay & green curry with duck and both were perfectly fine.
author: Teiki K.

description: Just ordered a bunch of lunch specials at my office. Everyone loved it. So much food for just $10...we all ordered different things and no complaints on anything. Curry is perfectly spicy and appetizers are delicious! I am very glad to have recommended this place because everyone in the office thinks I'm really cool now.
author: Laura M.

description: I just found this place over the weekend and ordered for pick up 2 x!  My friend and I couldnt believe how flipping good the green chicken curry is.  I seriously think it was the best i have had.  I also tried the coconut milk soup with chicken and it was great- v. fresh & great flavors.  This is my new go to in my new hood.
author: Lisa E.

description:
This is a review about Benjarong's delivery.
Ordered straightforward items from menu at 8:15 on a weeknight. Was told would be 40 minutes, even though we live just a few blocks away. Delivery came 52 minutes later. Even though we had asked for sides of soy, hot pepper sauce and spicy peppers, there were none at all in the bag. Called back to ask for delivery of sides, they arrived 15 minutes later. Good thing we didn't wait to eat, because the noodles dish was already cold and the cashew chicken was chewy. The tom kha soup was tasty, but seemed a little heavy on the palm sugar. Maybe it was just a bad night for them, but there's a lot of competition out there. Definitely a meh.
author: Mark R.

description: We were looking for food after a late evening meeting and found this place. pretty empty so service was fast and though i didn't try very many things, i did get the mango curry and it was amazing. only thai place i have ever seen it offered and it was so good.
author: Rachel C.

description:
I came here to grab Thai pick-up tonight and noticed they'd done some construction by moving the front door around a bit since the last time I was here. Sadly, it seems they may also have moved around things in the back of the restaurant too!

I ordered the Tom Yum soup, which was as good as ever, but the Pad Thai (the standard in Thai food) is extremely less than par for Benjarong. I'd always loved the Pad Thai here - the right balance of spicy/sour/sweet, and lots of peanut flavor and lime, but the Pad Thai tonight is basically just noodles with sauce and no flavor. VERY disappointing.

Maybe they changed management/chefs?

Sad.
author: Sally M.

description:
Today a coworker and I decided to order delivery. We were in the mood for some Asian food. And I immediately thought of Benjarong on Lombard. Since they are literally just down the block I had anticipated the really good meal that I have had several times at the restaurant. 

Unfortunately, that was not the case today. It took over 40 minutes for food to be delivered and we both thought that $40 for three items was a bit high for lunch. Portions were small. 

Tasty and flavorful, yes. But my coworker thought that the spicy beef with fresh basil should have been better. As he told me he has had much better at other Thai places at a cost much less. 

Rice included was a very small amount and I did not like the plastic containers. I think plastic containers for the delivery of hot food is not a good idea. The containers were difficult to open. 

The delivery clerk did not give us a receipt. The high price and the fact that it took over 40 minutes to delivery a simple noodle and rice dish did not make a good impression for my coworker. That is too bad because as I said I have eaten at Benjarong several times and enjoyed each dinning experience. 

With this delivery order I was disappointed as was my coworker. I guess Benjarong was not having a good day today or, it might be they are just not at their best for delivery.
author: Jonathan F.

description: We walked in and it was completely empty. But the Crispy Pork Basil was amazing. A little pricy, but so worth it
author: Jillian B.

description: Best Thai food I have had in san fran! I will definitely be returning to this great service, beautifully decorated, well plated restraunt.
author: Skye J.

description:
i cannot emphasize how horrible the service is here and how gross the food is. i will never come close to this place ever again. 

i ordered on grub hub and was forced to walk to the restaurant because i was $2 short of the delivery minimum. then i found out my yellow curry did not come with rice anymore (which is not indicated on the menu). when i asked for rice, the horrible AND RUDE waitress by the bar would not let me use my credit card as there was a $40 minimum she said. i begged her and told here there were no atm machines around and that i walked a mile to get there, but she didn't care. i have never been treated so poorly. 

the soup was disgusting and made me sick for 2 days. the yellow curry had barely any chicken. this is the worst review i have every written on yelp and deservingly so. this place should go out of business.
author: Jamal M.

description: Very flavorful Thai food!  Perfect amount of spice in the Basil fried rice with beef.  The vegetables were fresh and crispy.  Chicken Satay was very good and the peanut sauce was soooo sweat!  My friends said the Pad Thai was perfect.  The presentation for all of the dishes was the best I have seen at a Thai Restaurant.  The service was great, they even stayed open later to accommodate us.  We will be back for sure!
author: Lorenzo R.

description:
It's a really cute place...kind of loungy actually.  A nice gem in the neighborhood...without the swanky feel and price of Osha nearby.

My pad see ew was absolutely delicious, but my panang chicken curry was if they took some peanut butter, melted it, and plopped in some chicken.  So NOT okay.

I would definitely go back for the convenience (and they deliver)...but I've had better.
author: Vince S.

description: BEST Thai I've had in SF. I've been here a year and order thai about once a month. This is the ONLY order that left me NOT disappointed. Not only that, it was fucking GOOD. The pad thai was spicy and juicy, not dry. The green curry was delicious. Loved the eggplant in it. Thai fried rice was also very good. Best fried rice I've had aside from Benihanas. Yes please! Will order again.
author: Brittany S.

description: Nice food. Real good. Surprisingly not very busy when we entered on a Sat night (7:30pm).
author: Jonathan W.

description: Very good curry! some of the best curry I have had. The noodle dishes are good too. I would reccomend going here if you want thai in the marina area. And its not too expensive, especially considering the quality.
author: David W.

description: People should get over the portion size and be happy that the food they get is so delicious. Not only are the meals presented gorgeously, but they TASTE SOOOOO GOOD. The food is so fresh and delicious. LOVED LOVED LOVED. 2 thumbs up!
author: Anne B.

description: My wife and I were visiting from Los Angeles and stumbled upon this gem while we were sightseeing. This place has REALLY good Thai food and I highly recommend this place. Especially for the price. The Wonton Soup and Pineapple Fried Rice Dish were outstanding :) We will be back.
author: Christopher B.

description:
We walked in and were, at first, fairly turned off because the place smelled fresh off a Lysol bath, but the food was absolutely delicious. Honestly a really delightful and affordable lunch. 

Samosas and fresh spring rolls were great apps, and he curries went perfectly with their tasty brown rice. Five stars on the food, three on the ambiance. Nice service too.
author: Joey Z.

description:
Best Thai food I've ever had. our group tried the pumpkin curry, papaya salad, thai samosas, tofu spring rolls,  woon sen noodles, and more. there was not a single thing that we did not enjoy. 

Service was a little iffy since it was fairly empty in the restaurant and they could have been a little faster. They were polite and attentive when near the table.

What a delight!
author: Fifi B.

description:
This is the best in San Francisco.  I've eaten at a LOT of Thai places here.  The pumpkin curry, pa nang curry, and mango chicken curry are all awesome.  Also, the fresh rolls are incredible--they ARE very fresh.  Just can't get enough of those.

The service and decor are just fine, very friendly, and a comfortable place to dine.

Parking can be, uh... well I like to accentuate the positive, but be aware.  This area of Lombard Street is one of those areas like Clement Street, where parking can mean a LOT of circling around, so be warned.

But the food here is pretty wonderful!
author: Andrew H.

description:
I just finished stuffing my pie hole with Benjarong takeout. I ordered green papaya salad, phad thai, and thai iced tea. All of it was as good as I've ever had before. Nothing fancy, just really good foooood. Prices about average depending on the dish. 

The restaurant looks fairly contemporary for a Thai restaurant with white walls and tasteful artwork and a decent-looking bar (as opposed to the really tacky, loud, and ornate decorations of more "traditional" places). Went in on a Thursday night at about 8:30pm and the place was dead. Only 2 tables of 2 and 4. People are really missing out! I think a lot of these businesses directly on Lombard St. suffer for being on a major highway with lots of motor inns and a general lack of sexiness and cosiness that Chestnut and Union have. 

Anyway, it's gravy so if you're just looking for a no nonsense great meal give it a try. This will be my go-to take out place from now on.
author: Shawn C.

description:
Ok, so my last review of this place was not so great.  But I think they've improved when it comes to delivery, as we ordered from Benjarong tonight and it was at our door in twenty minutes (when they quoted forty).  Granted it was kind of early on a Monday night so I'm sure the place was pretty empty, but still...that's pretty awesome service!  So anyway, I thought my previous review required an update.

Also, I've eaten at the restaurant a couple of times, and while there was a bit of a language barrier with the waitress, service was very friendly and accommodating.

Some of my usual choices: pumpkin curry (so good!), panang curry, pad see ew, green papaya salad, and stir-fried veggies.  

I am so deliciously full right now, and I love it!  And even more, I love that I did not have to wait 2 hours for my food to arrive!  Yay!  :-D
author: Lindsay B.

description: Favs: Panang Curry, Pad See Ew, Tom Yum Soup, Pad Thai, Cashew Chicken. All super good- my fav Thai in the city
author: J F.

description:
This is based on their delivery through grubhub.com:

The green curry was creamy with just the right amount of curry; the papaya salad was very spicy and very tasty; the tom kha soup was awesome, although it was lacking on the veggies (the flavor was spot on); the chicken satay was dry and we would not order it again; the Thai Spicy Pan Fried Noodle was mediocre (the noodles were very soggy); the black peppers with beef was ok...taste wise it was good, but the texture was a little odd and it was drenched in oil. 

All in all, I would say it was "good" food, and we might order from them again, but only the curry, tom kha soup and papaya salad.  

The delivery was fast, too!
author: Ashley K.

description:
I don't often go out in the Marina but last night I ended up at a Happy Hour and a friend recommended Benjarong. Started with the Ahi Tuna Balsamic, which was so good that I could've ordered two and made a meal out of it. Next was my old favorite Basil Chicken Fried rice, which was peppered more than I'm used to but otherwise just spicy enough for me. 

Having observed another customer's sizzling plate o' meat, we immediately ordered the Black Peppers with Beef dish and were not disappointed. The portions look a little on the thin side but they filled up two hungry stomachs. 

Decor and service were both great. All I can say is that I wish there were more people with us so that I could sample more of their food. Looking forward to going back.
author: ChickCaesar S.

description: I recently ordered delivery for dinner and found a bug in the dessert I ordered. Completely disgusted, I tossed the food and called the restaurant to let them know what happened. The person who answered the phone was not apologetic at all and when he talked to the manager they decided I was lying because I didn't keep the food for them to see with the bug in it.  They decided not to refund the money for the dessert. Which is fine, I'm not going to fret over $6. However, the cleanliness and treatment after finding a problem with the food is unacceptable. I will never order food from bejarong again and encourage folks to watch out for what's in their food if they decide to eat there.
author: Jo V.

description:
I was really craving curry last night and had a huge paper due so I decided to yelp a restaurant that delivered curry!  I called in the first time, and no one answered, but they were the only restaurant open on Sundays before 5:00. So I called again.  The lady answered and took my order.  I thought I could just order curry and it would come with rice, because isnt that how you eat it?  I'm glad I asked because I had to order rice to go with it... but whatever. No big deal.  I ordered a small rice, because I was the only one eating it, and I didnt need to have tons of rice.  After I was done ordering she told me I had to have a $15 dollar order.  So i ordered the fried wantons.  

When the food got to my house I noticed that the order of curry was HUGE and the rice was in a small little box...  What was I going to DO with all that curry and barely any rice?

I loved the yellow curry, in fact, I am craving it now.  The wantons were alright. I was mad about the rice.

But I would order from them again.
author: Chelsea S.

description:
I just created my account just to review this restaurant!  I'm eating their Tom Yum soup with shrimp right now...LOVE IT! LOVE IT! LOVE IT!  If only their service is quicker, I'd give them a 5-star rating.  On the other hand, their food is so good but their service moves at turtle speed that I between the service and food...they only deserve a 3.  1 star for service and 5 for food.

On the BRIGHT side, if you're in no hurry, you GOTTA stop by the place and try their food.  You'll love it!  I LOVE food, but am a very picky eater.  On top of that, I'm very lazy about writing....especially reviews for anyone or anything that doesn't benefit me, yet their Tom Yum soup is so delish that I was completely inspired to set up a yelp account just to review them.  So if you have all the time in the world to enjoy food, this place is a must try!

Bon Appetit!

Oh yea, their price is fair as well!
author: My Loan J.

description:
WOW!  This place is yummy!  I happened by on my way home today, and am glad that I did!  The Chicken praram was soooooo good.  Pad Thai was the best I've had!  The portions they serve are large enough that I'll have lunch for the next couple days.

Great food, smiling staff, friendly owner.
It has quickly become one of my favorite restaurants in SF.
author: Jenn H.

description: Dear Benjarong, Your food is tasty, to be sure, but I finally hit my breaking point with your service. Each of the three people I spoke with this evening had such a difficult time understanding English that I repeated my telephone number and address at least fifteen times. It was frustrating as hell, which is exactly the opposite of what a lazy, ordering-in evening should be about. My food is now 45 minutes late because -- surprise! -- you still managed to write my address down wrong. I can't even bring myself to say "it's not you, it's me", because frankly, it *is* you. Toodles, Heather
author: Heather F.

description:
I love the take out/delivery box.  It's the nice flat rectangle shape box.  Its much more elegant than shoving it in a chinese take out box.  

I also love roti with curry and Benjarong has it.
author: Wakako U.

description:
Sensual seduction (no I am not quoting Snoop! =) )is what this place offers with its cute, dim interior, and delicious food.  Located conveniently right on Lombard in the Marina, this place creates some amazing Thai, along with Indian, Chinese, Malaysian, Singaporean, and Vietnamese appetizers, entrees and desserts.

We started with an appetizer of spring rolls, which were fried to perfection and had yummy mushroom, cabbage, and carrots stuffed inside.  We also had a spicy, tingling papaya salad, and some parantha (fried Indian dough).  The only suggestion we had was to serve the parantha with some sauce (maybe curry sauce as they often serve their parantha/roti kanai with at the Straits chain).  I ordered pumpkin curry with tofu, which was *awesome*!  I've never had pumpkin curry, and they managed to bring out all of its amazing flavors with a coconut base.  My friends ordered the Asian eggplant and spicy green curry.  All were great tasting dishes!  

Would definitely visit this fine establishment again!  Word of caution wrt the bathroom sink - there is a trick to put off the water; one must move the handles appropriately in order to reach the fine balance of "turn off" - regardless, this restaurant is a great treat for one's palate.
author: Megha S.

description:
I LOVE Thai food, and Benjarong confirmed that declaration once again.  We even toured the menu extensively (ordering 3 different entrees, an appetizer, and the mango sticky rice dessert - yum) and none of us were let down.  My one gripe is that rice comes at an extra charge - granted, it's only $1 more which is no biggie, but it's just nice when you don't have to feel like you're either a pig or racking up your bill ordering "extra" stuff to have a little brown rice with your meal.  

Decor is very modern and cool which is a nice change from most other Thai places I've been to of late.

Great prices and the friendliest service I've experienced in a long while.  Our waitress was incredibly nice, apologizing every time she had to reach over to fill our waters (unecessary but still a sweet gesture).  I agree with Rachel W. in that their spice scale is slightly tame (my boyfriend ordered a 9 out of 10 and I even thought it wasn't quite firey enough), but really, no complaints about this place.  So glad I found great Thai down the street!
author: Kate M.

description:
Surprisingly good!

We were just walking around looking for a breakfast or lunch place (ANYTHING that was open on New Years Day basically) and this is a hop-skip-and a jump from the apartment.  Done.

They have a good lunch combo thing with soup, app, and a curry.  You can pick your meat/tofu/veggie and there were 5-6 types of curry.  Really a good deal!!!!

The service was a tad slow but there was just one girl serving the 4-5 tables.  The cook just seemed really slow in the back, but I guess we weren't in any rush.  Just don't go there if you're in a time crunch I'd say.  Good overall experience though!!!
author: Lindsey S.

description:
4 tables, 2 waitresses.  Do the math.
But the service was so slow I was reduced to eating the
parsley garnish of my dinnermate (no, that's not
a euphemism). Ended up calling off my entree,
which was a salad. Ah, the complexities of making salad.
Paying the bill felt like tossing their salad.
The two stars are for the food.
In general, it irks me when a single bad experience causes
a reviewer to slam a place, but tonight was so ludicrous (I actually
had to get up from my chair to flag down the waitress on multiple occasions -- maybe they should provide semaphores when you walk in) that I'm going to break my own rule.
author: James F.

description:
What happened Benjarong?  I love your food, it is always fantastic, but how can you justify doubling some of your prices?

My wife called up last night, delivery menu in hand, and our usual order of about 40 bucks, had increased to 64 dollars.  Huh?  How did that happen?  Well, basically on certain items, like the awesome Seafood Soup, it has undergone a price increase from 3.95 to over 7 dollars.  Now call me naive, but how can any business justify doubling its prices overnight?  I know it is only 20 bucks, but when your usual bill goes up by so much, I find it hard to justify on principle.

i am gutted about this, I really am.  I love the food, but out of principle, I am going to have to go elsewhere.  Damn it!
author: Dazza M.

description:
Went here with the family over the Christmas holiday.

The quality of food was very good and the selections of Thai curries was great.  I had the Thai Hot basil pork with jasmine rice: it was text book.  Oh the rice: you get a choice of jasmine, sticky or brown which adds another dimension to your dining experience.

On a chilly Monday night we were the only ones in the place at 7 pm.  however pick up orders were flying out the front door while we were there, servicing the locals.
author: TIM M.

description:
I really enjoy Benjarong. I like the fact that it is a small place and the service has always been very attentive. Their menu is not too big, but I am always happy with what I get there. I really like their noodle dishes, as I fell they give a nice portion of meat  in them. If you are looking for a quit spot, this is a good place. I have also had take out several times and they are very prompt.
They give you a Tootsie Pop for desert. Got to love that!
*UPDATE*
I have ordered take out a few times and the service is so slow! I live across the street, so why does it take an hour and then the food is cold?
author: Lisa A.

description:
This past Fall we had our rehearsal dinner at Benjarong. It was the most affordable, pleasant experience. Since everything related to weddings in SF is so expensive, we were thrilled to get such a great deal at Benjarong.

The manager, staff and cooks were a pleasure to work with and very friendly. The catered menu was quite abundant and diverse (plenty of veggie options). It also included dessert!

The BEST part, we were able to rent the entire space, albeit a Thur. night. We had aprox. 45 guest and there was plenty more room. As mentioned, they were very accommodating, as they set up an area on the wall to play a slide show.

In the end they honored us w/ a Bamboo "luck" plant! Must be working...my husband and I are still happily married :)
author: Christina Y.

description:
It has a more upscale looking interior than most Thai joints.  But the prices aren't unreasonable; dishes are still under $10, with the exception of seafood.  For a better deal, stop in for lunch, where you can get appetizers, a tiny salad, and an entree for the same price--a good and filling meal.  One waitperson juggled serving all the tables well.  And the food came out fairly quick.  

Don't expect any cheapie mints as a thank you with your bill.  At Benjarong, they give out Tootsie Roll Pops--that's some serious bonus points.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
This is one of my favorite neighborhood restaurants! I almost always take out for delivery  and not because there is something wrong with the ambiance or the service. The food is always excellent, it is very consistent quality and the ingredients are always top notch for the price. I have not yet came across a mediocre dish. May favorite appetizer is "Thai samosa".
The duck red curry is great, spicy thai basil and many more.
author: Sam B.

description:
I'd give it a 2.5 stars.  Unfortunately I was disappointed by the food.  A few months ago we tried to eat on a Saturday night and it was so packed we ended up eating elsewhere.  This time, we made a reservation for a Friday night and even by 8pm we were the only people there? I did notice the "New Management" sign.

I ordered the Benjarong pan-fried noodles and bf got the "Asian Otak" chef suggestion. Our friend ordered fried rice and we also ordered a Tom Yum soup to start with.  I'm no Thai food expert, but have had my fair share of Thai foods and I didn't like the Tom Yum soup here.  It was way too sweet (almost syrupy).  The pan-fried noodles were described as "stir-fried thick rice noodles" but they weren't the flat noodles you usually get with like a Pad See-ew.  They were like ramen noodles or yakisoba noodles and mushy, probably overcooked? Flavor was good but the consistently was too mushy. The Asian Otak was a pretty impressive presentation of a banana leaf wrapping a curry-like mix of meat and vegetables. 

I'm not sure I'd come back. Despite being the only customers there, the food took awhile and service was okay.
author: Emiko M.

description:
Updated:
The restaurant has new owners and the food quality has gone down dramatically.  Too bad it was a great restaurant!!

We stumbled upon this restaurant when attempting to get in to the sushi place next door.  We couldn't get in and settled upon this place.  We were so lucky!  The servers there are so nice, it is a really modern atmosphere (except for the soft rock hits that the blast) and the food is probably the best Thai I have ever had.

It has never been crowded when we go, so I have been afraid it would close.  I hope the word gets out!!
author: Diane R.

description:
This is hands down the best Thai place in the SF! The place is small...the staff is friendly...the food is outstanding!

We found this place initially via Restaurants.com a few years ago...we have been hooked ever since.

All the food is delicious!
author: Daddy F.

description:
More of my SF fantasy breaker restaurant. 1 star for service, 1 star for the ambiance, 3 star less for bad food, bad food, and bad overpriced food.

It sucks when you order to go, you can't send the food back. You have already tipped them, and really there is nothing you can do to justify the bad $40 to go order dinner gone bad.

Absolutely the worst Tom Kha Kai (hopefully I spelled it right), the coconut milk chicken soup, I've ever had in my entire life. Fried rice mediocre at the best. I forgot what else I got... oh yea the silver noodle salad. Again, the worst I've had.

Yes the soup is "with" coconut milk, but the soup shouldn't be that sweet. It was one of my first times to blow soup out of my mouth like how they do in cartoon. It was that fuckin bad.

I feel bad because the place is so cute and nice, and the service very classy. Has nobody told them that their food sucks?
author: Kokoro I.

description:
The green curry is amaaaazing. Huge chunks of eggplant, spiced to perfection. Most of their dishes are slightly cheaper than the competing Thai places in the area, and significantly better.

Take out is quick and consistently solid. The inside is cute but not too crowded, seats around 20-25.
author: Sandra S.

description: I'll try to keep it brief: the best Pad Thai I have EVER had. Great curry, Tom Kha etc. Beautiful decor, excellent service and incredible presentation. Bonus: $10 lunch specials include soup & appetizer. Go here.
author: Trisha F.

description:
Ordered takeout here the other night. I liked how it arrived in a timely manner and how the food was wonderfully presented in their takeout boxes. I expected the food to just be glopped into their respective containers, because after all, it's only takeout. But I love the attention to detail that Benjarong has. As good as the food looked, it tasted good as well. 

This place has my approval. I've actually reheated and am eating leftovers as I'm typing this.
author: April B.

description: Our neighborhood lunch spot!    Lunch specials include entree, appetizer of choice and soup! for $8.95.  GREAT deal.  FANTASTIC food.  Go check it out.  You won't be disappointed.
author: Vivian E.

description: Ordered delivery and food was at my door within 20 min. Excellent quality, fantastic pumpkin curry, and fun colored vegtable flower thingies for my kid!
author: Drea L.

description: Another note about this restaurant is no mattter how many times you ask for your curry mild and not spicy, it will be spicy. Everytime I call I say please make that very mild because I can't do spicy and it comes spicy, is it so hard to make the food how the customer requests it?
author: Meghan A.

description: Less than one star. Disgusting is the best description. Seared ahi tuna appetizer was cold and served with an unsightly sauce covering the slices. Ordered duck pad Thai which was an option. Leathery old duck fat as though scraped off the road. So much oil there was a pool in the bottom of the bowl! Panang curry had sort if an off color and off flavor.
author: Eric M.

description:
I recently ordered take out from Benjarong when a curry craving set in. The Red Curry was packaged in a 1 quart plastic Tupperware container with far more broth than substance. This was fine because I love having soupy curry to pour on top of rice. 
The price was reasonable and my craving was satisfied. My only regret was not eating there. Benjarong was really charmingly decorated in authentic Thai fashion.
I was in and out pretty quickly, but was still impressed by the staff. 

Looking forward to coming back soon!
author: Charlie C.

description:
Service:  They were attentive, friendly, and refilled our water glasses frequently.

Setting: It was clean, the bathroom was clean, the artwork is nice, and the lighting was dark (maybe a bit too dark, but still okay).

Food:  My BBQ beef was really salty, but my friends' pumkin curry, egg noodle crepe, and eggplant dishes were good.  It's hotter than average spicy, but I didn't mind.  One weird thing is that they took away one of my friend's plates even though we all planned to eat family style.  The food was okay, but nothing special.

Speed: SLOW.  There were only 3 tables eating and we didn't get our food out until at least 45 minutes after we sat down.

Price: A bit pricey for Thai and for the quality of food.  ~$15 a person for King of Thai quality food.

With so many Thai options on Lombard: Gatip, Yukol, Benjarong, Tom Yum, this place doesn't do too much to make itself more distinctive.  I'd say it's a decent choice if you find yourself on that end of Lombard Street and you want Thai, but I wouldn't go out of my way to go back.
author: Mercutio k.

description: They won me over with nice service and the flowers that adorned my plate. We were the only occupied table the afternoon we went this summer so I wanted to get the word out because this place was great. I get green curry everywhere I go. It was one of the best I've had. Stop by!
author: Lindsay H.

description:
I have run by this restaurant several times and finally had the chance to check it out tonight. The food was pretty typical for a Thai restaurant, but the atmosphere and food presentation were fantastic - especially considering Thai restaurants usually aren't award-winning in the decor department. We had the fried tofu and Benjarong spring roll with tofu to start - both were excellent and the portions were large enough that we were able to split them among three people. I had the Thai fried rice with tofu for my entree, which was good, but nothing special. However, all the food is presented  really well, with nice, colored garnishes. 

The one HUGE drawback was the service. We were one of only two parties in the establishment and were not attended to very well. It took forever to get refills on our wine/beer and each of our three entrees were served five to 10 minutes apart - it was really strange. 

All-in-all, I definitely recommend it as a dinner place, but not for a quick lunch.
author: Randi W.

description:
The only thing better than this Thai cuisine is their fried banana dessert!  Delicious.  Freakin delicious!

...and I don't even like bananas.  But they serve the fried banana with coconut ice-cream and generously drizzle honey all over the top.  

Try it, you'll love it.
author: Kelsey C.

description:
Believe me I want to love this place I really do. The food is so good. I could seriously eat the green curry everyday, and the home made peanut sauce is to dye for.

With that said.... here are the negatives. I have ordered from here over 15 times and maybe once they got my order right. Which I find to be difficult to mess up considering I order through grub hub and everything is perfectly typed. The food is usually cold, still tasty but needs a warm up. And lastly the customer service sucks. When I've spoken to them over the phone they are curt and unfriendly. 

So if you willing to deal with all of the bull you will definitely get some really awesome food.
author: Lexi P.

description: My favorite neighborhood thai spot! Love their lamb, spicy noodles, and tom kahn soup! All in all, a great takeout choice.
author: Lauren J.

description:
There have been three incarnations of this place when I have eaten here.  I think the second one was the best.  I enjoyed the modern decor, the cool back booth area for groups, the wine list, and the good food.

I recently ventured in with a friend and noticed that they have changed back to more traditional decor.  The people here are very friendly and nice.  The food was ok.  We tried the catfish salad with mango, a traditional Thai dish that I haven't seen on any American menu.  I am loving the deep fried chewy catfish and raw mango in this salad in Thailand.  The Benjarong version was pretty plain.  The fried catfish was heavy on the batter and not a lot of fish.  I couldn't taste the mango.   The green curry tasted a bit watery and was probably from a mix.  Portion size is quite generous.

I liked the quiet and friendly atmosphere and may come back another time.
author: apple r.

description: On a Thursday night, the day before me and my girlfriend were heading back up to Portland, Oregon, we looked online to find a restaurant to have our last dinner at. We had found a vegetarian/vegan place that looked great, but when we walked there around 8:30 PM, we discovered that it was closed. Right next door to them was this Thai restaurant (Thai food caters easily to vegetarian/vegan cuisine), so we agreed to go on in. Wow! I am so happy that we did. The atmosphere inside was beautiful, romantic, and quiet, and the two women working that evening were very polite and cordial. We ordered several appetizers, two dishes, and some drinks, and everything tasted extraordinary! We both would definitely recommend this place to anyone, locals or visitors, who are in the area and looking for a great menu with great food!
author: Jesse K.

description:
The quick version: great decor, decent food - but we've had better Thai.

This was the first time trying Benjarong despite having driven right by it hundreds of times. We had desperate need of some Thai, and our usual go-to place was closed for the holiday, so Benjarong made the top of the list. 

Since our food was take-out, I'll cut them some slack for the food cooling down on the drive home and settling in at home. However, my girlfriend's beef was borderline cold (not even lukewarm), and my beef was slightly overcooked. The flavors were ok, and they did a nice job on presentation of the food - impressive considering this was takeout and it was a little box. :)

Getting the food itself was slow - when we entered, there were 3 full tables with maybe 15 guests. Unless they had a big rush on take-out or delivery orders ahead of ours, we were quite suprised it took 30 minutes from time of order until it was ready... that's quite a lot for two simple dishes to go, especially since 75% of the tables were empty.

The restaurant itself is very nice - great decor, nice ambiance, very cozy feeling. It hits just the right note of classy and downscale. We also liked the little cushioned-seat nook by the bar where people waiting for takeout can sit - it's cool. 

Although our first experience wasn't the greatest, it wasn't bad. We'll give it another try, probably eating in the dining room next time, so maybe we'll see Benjarong get another star or two from me. But for now, based on this experience, the food warranted an "ok" and has to settle for 3 stars.
author: Gregg G.

description:
Pleasantly surprised!

Nice little mom and pop Thai joint in the Marina. It was actually the third choice after the first two restaurants were we wanted to go to were closed, but I am glad I tried it. The food portions were nice and big and very tasty. I had the garlic noodles with pork and chicken basil with veggies and it was great. The chicken dish was a little spicy, but that's what you get at a Thai joint. Also tried the Spring Rolls and was satisfied. 
The staff was super friendly and kept refilling our water. We must have drank a gallon.  Over all I enjoyed my unexpected visit to Bejarong and look forward to coming back. 

For the people that said it was wheelchair accessible, they must have forgotten that up have to walk up a couple steps to get to the bathroom. So no, it is not wheelchair accessible.
author: Eric B.

description:
This place opened in early September '05 and its quite a gem. If you like great, fresh thai food in a very clean modern setting, then this is the place for you. My three favorite thai dishes are: pad thai, yellow coconut curry/chicken and som tum(green papaya salad). They deliver all of these at the high end of anything that i have had in SF. I tried a seafood dish with peanut sauce and that was great too. Sorry i forgot the name. 
The owners are very nice people and are customer driven. Due to their lack of advertising at this point, its easy to get a seat. Once the word spreads i think it will be a very popular place.

The restaurant is located a few doors down from zushi puzzle, a great sushi place and close to silver clouds karaoke so u can grab some great food and be an idiot afterwards!
author: Not M.

description:
Holy Pad-Thai.....Bat Man!

I had dinner here last night. It was an exquisite experience. Around 8:30 I had just thrown 2 loads of clothes in the dryer at the laundry mat down the street. I was walking up Lombard to grab some chicken tacos at Taco Bell when I passed this place. I peeked inside and the only people inside were the staff hanging out at the bar. Screw Taco-Bell....I poked my head in and asked if I could join them. The 3 sweetest Thai ladies you've ever seen welcomed me in like family. 
They asked me about which cities to visit in the US and why San Francisco was so cold. While I explained everything weird in US culture to these ladies I got to have the BEST POMEGRANATE MARTINI ever, it was like drinking liquor distilled by angels. For an appetizer order the THAI SAMOSAS. It's a lot lighter than the Indian variety with a sweet spicy sauce containing green apples, carrots, mint, and a hint of tamarind. Quite possibly the best samosas ever created.
If you like curry, go for the red. it's spicy, but awesome. The chef is this wonderful little lady that works magic with thai food. The woman makes food that shoots sparks and has fairy dust floating around it..... Yeah, it's that good.
The night went on and after my 3rd pomegranate martini I realized I only had 10 mins before the laundry mat closed. I promised I would be back and told the ladies to keep doing what they were doing because this place was a shining star among all the Thai restaurants in the city.
author: Mark B.

description:
Yah thats right, I gave them 5.

Because you know what, nothings perfect but this place comes pretty damn close. 

Yah yah yah....some things on the menu aren't AMAZZZING but for the most part, Benjarong is always a hit and furthermore, not a rip off!

6 Dollar cocktails in the marina! A miracle! I wish I could give SIX stars for that! The pumpkin curry is so savory and wonderful. Nice atmosphere. Attentive service. And GREAT delivery!

Screw Osha and their silly menu and crazy prices! 
Im telling you....this place is BETTER!
author: Dandy O.

description: decent thai but nothing special. my friend couldn't eat meat due to lent so we ordered a bunch of seafood stuff. we ordered a soft shell crab glass noodle clay pot dish. the two items together seemed disjointed. the other two dishes we ordered were shrimp dishes and each dish only came with about 8 shrimp. errrrr i eat about 10 shrimp in one normal dish myself so 8 wasn't really cuttin' it for three women. i left unsatisfied.
author: Regina C.

description:
I will have to ask for things spicier next time, because everything was mild.  But great flavors, very clean looking space (always nice environment to eat in), and good service.  Very, very affordable, especially considering how good the food was.  The hot and sour soup was great, with lots of big shrimp in there.  And the pad thai was good too.

EDIT 6/21/2007:  Under new management in the past couple of weeks.  Used to be so good.  Prices are inflated.  The food was still okay.  Why the 1star then, you ask?  I have never, in my life, had worse service at a restaurant.  There were 4 other people there, and at least 2 people on the floor.  It took 10 minutes to get water, and another 20 to get someone to take our order!  Hello, we're trying to pay you to make overpriced food, hello?  Anyone?  A party of 7 came in and sat down next to us.  Tourists.  They would have ordered entrees per person and appetizers.  After 15 minutes of nobody coming to see them, they walked.  There was nobody else in the restaurant at the time besides us.  Time to find a new Thai place close by!

EDIT 12/7/07:
What would make me go back to a previously 1-star reviewed restaurant?  A Valu-Pak SuperSaver coupon, of course!  AND AM I GLAD I DID.  It was amazing this time.  Soothing music on, attentive waitress.  And it was the BEST Thai food I've had in a long time.  Tom-Yum soup with shrimp was spicy and delicious.  Thai red curry with chicken and Thai Hot Basil with beef were phenomenal.  Indian fry bread was crispy, chewy, and delicious.  And if you've got a coupon, all that and 2 beers were less than $30.  But I will go back...even without the coupon.  Now that's a testament.
author: Rachel W.

description:
Don't remember what was here before, but had a wonderful MANGO curry that I haven't found at other Thai restaurants. 

Would feel comfortable having  a business lunch here. Prices are a bit higher than other Thai places, but perhaps the decor, service and quality of some of its ingredients in the mango curry. Didn't care too much for the soup yet enjoyed the small salmon salad. 

Noticed some unique soju drinks on the menu, but didn't imbibe.
Wouldn't make a special trip just for this place unless have to do other things in the Fort Mason area on a windy weekday afternoon.

Somewhere between Laguna and Buchanan on Lombard.
author: miriam b.

description: Yikes... I'm usually relatively forgiving about slow delivery, or other minor things, but this place is the under-achiever of Thai food restaurants in SF. The delivery took 20 minutes longer than they quoted, and the chicken and beef in all the dishes we ordered way over-cooked...dry and leathery. I gave up half way through, it just wasn't edible. Over- or under-seasoned meat might be subject to personal preference, but having all your dishes turn out like shoe leather isn't as forgivable. Hopefully it was just an off night, but it was all a big enough turn-off that I wouldn't give this place a second chance to redeem itself.
author: Julia F.

description:
I just went there for my first time last week. The decor and atmosphere was pretty cool. 

I got the Duck Curry and the portions were pretty big so I had plenty for leftovers the next day.  They don't have the awesome pancake bread that some of my other favorite thai places do but they do have a really good crispy Indian bread that's a must-have.
author: Gordon B.

description: Worst pad thai I've ever had and the spring rolls, not so great either. There are numerous Thai restaurants that are way better.
author: Kelli P.

description: I won't be ordering from Benjarong again.  I placed an order at 5:30, didn't get my food delivered until 7:30 and only live 2 miles from the restaurant.  It was cold when it arrived, and the portions were very skimpy. I called the restaurant about an hour after I ordered just to be told the driver wasn't in and should be there in five minutes.  Another hour later, the food arrived and the delivery guy had the stones to haggle me on the tip - he said the reason it took so long is because he had to drive so far...pardon me while I break out my tiny violin and play a sad, sad song.
author: Brandon M.

description: This place is really a gem! After trying most of the Thai restaurants in my tri-hood: Marina, Cow Hollow and Russian Hill, we haven't been amazed by anyone in particular. It seems that a lot of our restaurants rotate spots on our fave list.  However, when we found Benjarong, we felt that it was our new secret fave Thai spot.  We stopped by the other night and walked over enjoying the warm weather. The panang curry was aaaamazingingly delicious. It was so tasty that we just wanted to eat the sauce by itself. I also had the banana blossom salad which was also very tasty and the flavoring was very good. Finally we had string beans with tofu and it was also tasty. The food isn't greasy and they decorate all plates with cute colorful carrots shaped into flowers. Nice touch.
author: Natalie S.

description: 80% of the time, this place serves up the best Thai Food in SF. The other percent is "eh"...I should know, for a year, my roommates and I ordered it 3 times per week (collectively). Minor drawback to delivery: you need to be known by the deliverer in order to ensure your food is on time - cold Thai that is supposed to be hot is a bummer...
author: Joe W.

description: My boyfriend and I went with some friends to root for Nevada in  the Kraft Hunger Bowl at AT&T Park.  We rented a house in Pacific Heights and went for a fabulous walk to the waterfront.   I was CRAVING ethnic food, so we started looking and came across this place on Lombard and decided to check it out.  It was early - around 11:30 and only one other customer was in there.  The place was immaculate and very tastefully decorated - not cheesy.  The staff was friendly, responsive and accessible.  The food took a long time, but was WELL worth the wait.  Fresh, quality ingredients and authentic style.  I would highly recommend it!  The pumpkin curry was amaaaazing.
author: Linda P.

description: I absolutely love Benjarong. The food is reasonably priced, always fresh and consistently delicious. It's a family owned business that makes you feel like home when you eat there. I've been been looking for another Thai restaurant that will rival Osha without the high prices and Benjarong delivers. The pumpkin curry is hands down the best in the city and the Pad Thai will never disappoint. Thanks Benjarong! This review was a long overdue.
author: Van T.

description: We decided to go here on a Saturday night around 7pm and it wasn't very busy but the food was excellent.   The Tom Kha soup was some of the best I have ever had.   The spicy lamb and pumpkin curry were very good also.  Service was good and the restaurant had a very nice atmosphere (they give you real cloth napkin & cloth placemat; the dishware was also unusual and a nice touch).   Would definitely recommend and go back.
author: Matthew J.

description:
I'm giving this place a 4.5 instead of a 5.  First, let me say 90% of the entire meal was AMAZING!  For atmosphere, presentation, price, taste, service, everything would get a 5.  

I ordered the fresh roll for an appetizer and it was one of the best I've ever had - definitely enough for 2 people to split.

My boyfriend had the samosas which were also great.

For an entree, I ordered the duck curry - the flavor was amazing, but my biggest problem with this meal is that the "duck" portion of it was mostly fat and skin and hardly any meat.  I have had this dish at many other thai restaurants around the country and benjarong's taste and presentation was the best, but the fattiness of the duck brought my rating down to a 4 - which made me sad because I really wanted to give them a 5!

My boyfriend had the beef panang curry and his dish was wonderful...some of the best panang curry I've had!

Also, they let you byob which was very nice since we were celebrating and did not like their champagne selection.

I was shocked to see this place so empty on a Saturday night and thought about keeping my review from yelp so it would remain an uncrowded secret.  But I had to share the wealth so here is my advice - go check it out!
author: Julia J.

description: These folks make a lovely Green Curry.  And believe me: I know Green Curry.  When you've been around as long as I have, you've eaten a few.  ...so you can judge.  And THIS place has one of the best Green Curries I have ever eaten: Spicy, yet incredibly tasty.  Great variety of vegetables in it.  I love the bits of pumpkin in there.  A real pleasant surprise.  So far, everything I've had from Benjarong has been excellent.  It has already become my go-to place for Thai takeout.  I look forward to trying more items from their menu.  Maybe tonight...
author: Eric H.

description: The food is good, but unbearably slow.  I wished I'd gone somewhere else for dinner.
author: Jeremy B.

description:
Very good service and clean, nice decor.  Quite affordable given the decor and location.  

The food was pretty good, but not the best Thai I've had in SF.  

We started with the chicken satay.  This was excellent and I highly recommend it. 

The papaya salad, however, wasn't anything to write home about.  It was fairly bland and, really, not very good compared to the papaya salad from a place like Marnee Thai. 

I got the larb (minced chicken with lettuce and lime) as my main dish.  It was quite good!  The texture was nice, everything tasted very fresh, and it was just spicy enough.  A bit heavy with the lime, but then that may be because this dish may traditionally call for a lot of lime. 

The masaman curry with beef seemed very heavy and not very nuanced.  

The wine list was super-basic but also quite affordable, so I'm not complaining! 

The service was really good though.  Four stars is a bit generous, but the vibe from the proprietor was too nice to ding them with a 3-star rating.
author: J L.

description:
Went to lunch here last weekend and I must say, I was very impressed.  There are several beautiful paintings decorating the walls - definite conversation pieces.  The plating was exceptional for lunch and the portions were more than generous.  I had the pumpkin red curry and the spice was intense and satisfying.  

Go here!
author: Steve G.

description: ive been to many thai restaurnats in the bay area and this one is one of the better ones ive been too. the food was very good and the girls that work there are really sweet. the prices are moderate and the decor was cute. BEST THING: food WORST THING: if anything the service was a little bit slow and it was empty when we were in there, thank god the olympics was playing on the big screen or else i would have been really bothered.
author: Eliza B.

description: Benjarong must have read my last review because they totally redeemed themselves with quicker delivery service, better cooks and a computerized system that keeps your name and address on file!  I order from here pretty regularly now, and everytime gets better than the last.  The red curry with vegetables is amazing!  I totally heart their Pad Thai, and Benjarong fresh rolls.  The best thing on their menu: the lunch special.  A cup of soup, an appetizer, an entree and rice for $10! Keep it up Benjarong!
author: Zaneta C.

description: Awesome place. Probably one of the best Thai restaurants I've been to. The food is awesome...my favorite is the seafood dish with the peanut sause. And all the appetizers are really tasty. The service is exceelent and the owner is very nice. The restauraunt is done up very nice and fancy and so makes for a great place for a dinner date.
author: Alex F.

description: We ordered through Grub Hub, so I can't comment on the restuarant itself, only the food. The quality of the meat and vegetables in the Red Curry with Chicken and Panang Curry was very good, and the curry itself was quite tasty. I loved the Tom Kha, but my wife felt that it had too much coconut milk in it that made it too sweet. It was definitely on the sweet side. We were disappointed that the jasmine rice we ordered didn't arrive and we felt it was odd that the curry dishes didn't come with rice, which brings down our review by a star. That said we will order from here again, making sure we get the right rice next time.
author: Alexander O.

description:
yum.

the premiere of project runway was upon us. i made the very bad choice of thinking i could bring my dog to a friend's house.  she's so calm at home, i swear! eh... i felt like i was apologizing for my rampant toddler. but anyway,  i wasn't too distracted from keeping my dog away from my food and excitedly evaluating the the new project runway contestants to notice that the take out I was eating- a savory cashew tofu was actually quite incredible and made note of the name of the place. benjarong, you made quite the impression.
author: Liz S.

description: This place is so hit or miss. It seems to only be a a hit when I've eaten here and mostly crash & burn when I've ordered delivery. Once I called to order delivery and the woman told me I was out of their delivery area, I reminded them they had delivered to my home a week before. Then she told me it was too late for delivery..  Should I even continue? The flashbacks are making me angry. I like their food when you dine in; good Tom Yum and Pad Se Eew. Once my food had so much MSG... I had to take Nyquil to get to sleep. I would eat King of Thai anytime I needed Thai, unfortunately they don't deliver.
author: Tracy C.

description:
Very clean. They actually scrub down the tables after guests leave. The food looks and tastes really clean as well. The staff is friendly, but they really should learn some English. 
I wanted to order a salad, but I wanted to know if they use lettuce to make their salads, because some salads don't. It was a simple question- do you put lettuce in your salads? And the server could not understand my question. Forget it, I'll just order a lunch combo- green curry with chicken. 
We also wanted to get a lunch combo to go for a friend. But it took awhile to explain that we wanted our food for dine in, but one extra dish to go. But she finally got it thank goodness.
So we eat, get our to-to food, pay and leave. When we got back to my friend's apt, he opens up the food to eat. The first thing he asks- where's the rice??
what? No RICE?! How can you forget the rice in a curry dish? Outrageous. Rice is just rice, but what if you don't have a rice cooker at home? I was pretty mad. So I decided to walk all the way back to get the rice and complain. If restaurants mess up on something like that, don't they usually give you a future discount, or free dessert or something?? I was determined to get something. After all, we walked home, had to walk all the back to the restaurant, then walk back home! 
So when we got back, I complained about the rice not being in the bag, that we had to walk all the way back, and I expect some sort of compensation for this. You know what their form of compensation was? Returning a dollar fifty for the rice. I was pretty confused actually. I've never seen that before. Is that normal? I don't know. I just left the restaurant. There are many better Thai restaurants in the area. I'll opt for one of those, the next time I feel like Thai.
author: Jeanie C.

description:
ugh, this place left me with a bad taste in my mouth and cancerous deep fry in my belly.  

First of all the service.  We had some issues with our waitress understanding our questions.  We wanted to know whether she thought the papaya or the mango was a better in season choice, but instead were treated to a word for word reading of the description on the menu.  Thanks!  Throughout the meal we had to deal with our dirty plates from the soup, salad, longer than we should have.

Second, the green mango salad was anything but green.  Instead of getting a green mango we had sweet ripe yellow mango.  On top of the salad was the largest soft shell crab I've seen, largely because it was so heavily breaded and burnt to a crisp.  Maybe the last time they changed the oil in the friar Nixon was still the president because it was borderline blackened.  We knew that didn't bode well for the next dish we had coming out, which was the fried chicken over fried rice (yeah I'm addicted to king of thai noodle version so I sometimes try it elsewhere).  

   The fried chicken was the crunchiest and most difficult to dinner item I've had in recent memory.  Again, almost blackened, nothing like the light brown that was portrayed in the menu and so tough and overdone it nearly shredded my throat on the way down.

Two stars rather than one because it looks nice inside.
author: Stephen H.

description:
It seems I shared something with many of the other yelpers here......terrible service. 
I will admit I was a bit irritated to begin with because I originally went to this area of the city for Indian food but the place was closed and opened till 5, I was ravenous so I didnt want to wait, I walked around and this place was open and sounded good.
The place is very quaint, great decor, cute tables etc, etc.

My bf and I sat there for a good 5 minutes or more and were just kind of ignored, it was not busy at all, two tables with people that had already ordered. One of the girls glanced at us a couple of times and just when I was getting ready to get up and leave she came to ask us for our order.
I decided to calm down and order anyway, we both ordered curry that didn't even come with rice?? ok, $2 more.
After waiting for what seemed like forever the waiter came out with my bf curry only, saying my plate would be out shortly, sigh, I think 5 minutes later my plate came out. 
My bf curry was warm, not hot and more on the sweet side but good, mine was hot and pretty tasty.
Overall food is decent but a bit overpriced given anything you ask for is extra, like rice and extra mushrooms.
After we were done eating we waited forever to ge the check, and then again to get it back. Horrible service and worse is that the waiter has a problem understanding english.
author: M J.

description: Best yellow curry in san francisco, everything all my friends got was incredible too. Also, you have to try the lechee martini
author: Bennett P.

description: The food at this place was outstanding -- really flavorful and amazing.  A bit pricier than other Thai places, though I confess I don't eat this kind of food frequently. Dinner for four of us, one beer each plus one appetizer to share, was $90. Yikes. The waiter seemed really stressed out (even though the place wasn't that busy), and in a huge hurry in general. Overall, the food was great. Service and prices, eh.
author: H H.

description: Ordered for delivery last night and food was pretty tasty.  We ordered the duck curry and the spicy noodles with salmon.  Both were really good.  The curry portions were larger than typical so I had enough for lunch the next day!
author: Mitzi C.

description: Epitomizes fake Thai food. Don't ever go here unless you were once a member of a soroity or fraternity. Avoid if you know anything about Asian food especially Thai food.  Pleasant decor - thats it.
author: Snubby J.

description: I noticed a sign at the restaurant that they are under new management so that could explain the price increase as noted by another reviewer.  I ordered the grilled salmon and pad see ewe with tofu.  Grilled salmon was good but was hoping for the kind of salmon with the grill marks on it.  Pad See Ewe was just ok, maybe a little on the sweet side.  It was served with a combination of regular and Chinese broccoli and the regular broccoli seemed to absorb the garlic flavor. Noodles were just ok it looked like a pasta noodle, not the glutinous thick chewy kind I've come to enjoy when I'm at Krung Thai in San Jose.
author: Cindy B.

description: Pretty much the tastiest yellow curry I've had in San Fran.
author: Tim G.

description: I live about 4 doors down from Benjarong so I eat their takeout weekly. After more than a year, I can't get tired of their fresh, hot, delicious food. The coconut soup is amazing, the curries are fantastic.  The masatman curry, with pineapples, potatoes, and a brown sauce, served with brown rice is my go-to meal. If you like it spicy, tell them so, on a scale of 1 to 10, and they'll hook you up. The atmosphere is elegant, not overdone, and I've never gone when you couldn't get a table immediately.
author: Hurston P.

description:
we love this place, order from them twice a week.  The bbq chicken is delicious!  we love the fresh spring rolls, and the yellow curry too.  
fast and friendly delivery service and not overpriced.  love love benjarong!
author: suzanne d.

description: My fave Thai delivery place!  All the curries are great, as are the tofu satay, the green papaya salad and the mango dessert!!  Have yet to eat in the restaurant, but the food quality is stellar even in delivery, which says a lot.  Just don't order too many times so they up the charges, ok? :)
author: S B.

description:
positive: decor, service, veggie fresh rolls. 
negative: Tom Ka vegetarian soup was too sweet.
Vegetable delight entre was too sweet.
author: Larry H.

description: Well, well, well. Looks like I've found a close competition to my other favorite take-out joint, Dragon Well. I ordered the Larb minced chicken salad tonight (thanks to a trusted recommendation) and I must say it was delicious and not quite so heavy as Dragon Well's lettuce cups (which I will always love, just because). A word of warning, they mean business in the "how spicy do you want it" department.  I ordered it "medium" and it was almost too hot for my taste buds to handle.
author: a p.

description: I love the set up of the place, it has a great feel to it. The place is a little expensive for Thai but it was good. I am huge fan of the egg rolls I am always in search for great eggs roll with great sauce that won't make your stomach ache later. Friendly service. I also really liked the bar they have a nice set up, might go back and do some saki bombs!
author: Danielle K.

description: I've been to many Thai restaurants in San Francisco but this one is AMAZING! Thai food is not my choice of food, but I go because my wife likes it. This restaurant changed my take on Thai food. Now Thai food from Benjarong is top on my list of places to eat. Not only does the food look fabulous, it tastes remarkable as well. My favorite is the peanut sauce that is used. Benjarong is the best!
author: Matthew T.

description: We came at 4:30 which may have been a little early for the staff cause they were pissed we came. They sat us down nevertheless and we had a very enjoyable dinner. Seafood salad, pad see ew and my seafood dish of some sort were all tasty if a little americanized.
author: Andy L.

description:
This might just be my favorite place for Thai food in the city.  My roomie and I love to order in from this place.  The owner will deliver the food right to your door in a timely manner.  The food is delish, some of my fave's are the pad thai, roti bread, and all the curries.
It's easy to get a table.  I almost didn't want to yelp about this place just to keep it a secret.
author: Ashley Q.

description: At last a great Thai place not too far from home! Nice decor, great service, and the food is fantastico! Favorites - basil chicken wings, Tom Yum soup and Kee Mow garlic basil noodles. Great for dining in or picking up to go.
author: Sarah R.

description: We've ordered delivery from Benjarong about 4 or 5 times and I've finally found a dish I liked....the fried rice w/ prawns.  I've tried the panang curry, the larb salad, pad eggplant and they were either too sweet or the meat too gristly.  But the prawn fried rice was to my liking.  There were a lot of prawns in the dish...most places usually give you 3 or 4.  This dish had 9!  And best of all, we've noticed they actually clean their prawns.  No unsightly prawn poop here...  And delivery time has been great, usually 30 minutes or less.
author: Lisa C.

description:
i used to like benjarong a lot and would rely on it for take out, but lately i feel like their quality has become less consistent. in addition, they sometimes take forever to deliver, even though i only live about two blocks away.

however, doesn't mean the food is pretty good. one of the standouts here is the pineapple fried rice. it's some of the best pineapple fried rice i've ever had. the curries are solid as well, lots of flavor. stay away from their papaya salad, which is doused in dressing. 

at this point i'm going to plug tawan thai food, which my fav thai delivery, and possibly my fav any cuisine delivery. i love that place so much.
author: Jessica W.

description:
i really wanted this place to be 4 stars...sigh..

we happened to walk by there and i was like "hey! this was on check please, i remember the good reviews on the show and i remember checking it on yelp after check plz and it was 4 stars"
obviously we shuldve went when it was still 4 stars coz now they've become 3 and a half.

the restaurant was empty (evening) but i noticed alot of pick up and delivery. the food was just okay. the salmon fried egg roll...they have this vegetable in it that has a strong taste and it wasn't balanced - it was in one spot of the roll and i dunt prefer the taste as much bcoz it was overwhelming - if it was chopped and spread throughout the roll,  it wouldve tasted alot better. i expected bigger rolls becoz its egg rolls - if its egg rolls the rolls have to be a certain size so it doesnt seem too hard and layered when u bite into it.

i had the green tofu curry. the green curry was great. the food didnt come hot only warm - i didnt like that bcoz food tends to cool very quick but what i mostly didnt like was the tofu. it was not cooked - i kno its precooked in the package but all they did was sliced it into cubes and added it to the curry so it was warm tofu not cooked tofu so the texture and taste was unappealing - i only had a few coz i culdnt eat it anymore but i ate the rest of the curry. tofu is suppose to be soft and succulent and any other place would let the tofu marinate in the curry for awhile and/or make it more appealing - grill it or something. i was really disappointed.
my guest had the crispy pork w/ basil - his only dislike was there was too much sauce in the dish but the pork was darn crispy.

i might give it another try if im around the neighborhood but i will not get any tofu unless its fried becoz i will know its been cooked and cared for.

sorry benjarong
author: Janet W.

description: Great Thai food, nice decor, but surprisingly not much traffic.  A great place to drop in for a nice quick dinner.
author: Dave L.

description: My parents know the owners, they try their hardest to make it. Cut throat business out there. I like their food, it's very nicely displayed and good on the taste buds. I recommend the samosas and yellow curry, but if you don't like curry don't get those two, it's like curry explosion.
author: Kimberly S.

description: This place has changed hands and it is now DISGUSTING. Don't waste your money.
author: Laurian R.

description: Best Thai food in the Thai food saturated Marina.  Great food for takeout or dine-in.  The staff is very friendly and it has a nice, clean atmospehere.  Their Red Thai Curry and "Indian Bread" are a great combo but you can't really go wrong with anything on the menu.
author: Mike B.

description: I've been to many Thai restaurants in San Francisco but this one is AMAZING!  Not only does the food look fabulous---it tastes remarkable as well.  Your experience here will be fantastic!!!
author: Smoking D.

description: I Paid $12 for a meal that should have cost $20. I don't know why this place was empty. I've eaten at fancier thai restaurants- they're not better than this one.
author: Nick B.

description: Got take out from Benjarong last night for the first time.  The atmosphere is different from most thai places because it is elegant and clean (white table cloths).  The food was pretty darn good for Thai take out.. we had yellow chicken curry, pad thai and the special corn fritter appetizer.  Not heavy or greasy... tasted fresh and cooked nicely.  Portions were huge and prices were reasonable (not cheap for thai, but totally reasonable).  They deliver too... a great find!
author: Mary S.

description: For a neigborhood restaurant, this is quite the find.  The food was very good and more surprisingly, it had a really nice decor.  The prices are very, very reasonable--so if you want good Thai food with some ambiance and attentive service, stop by.
author: Nancy H.

description:
This place is so tasty! Not only was the presented beautifully (very artful), the attention from the staff (until they got super busy) was fabulous. They came around and actually asked about the flavor of the food, if there was anything that we didn't like. 
I will definitely be frequenting Benjarong often.
author: AC C.

description:
A very nice experience.

Good service, good food, nice atmosphere.

The salmon salad was great but the spicy catfish entree is what really makes this a five star experience.  A perfect Thai dish with enough spice that the top of my head was tingling.  I would go back to eat this again and again.  The bean sauce that was the basis for the eggplant with optional meats was a bit too salty.  I'll stick to the spicy catfish next time!!
author: Richard P.

description: Benjarong is one of my favorite restaurants in my neighborhood.  Their food is consistently clean tasting and very flavorful & delicious. The ambiance is pleasant, and the restaurant is kept neat and clean. The food presentation is very pretty, too. Their prices are pretty decent, so I often find myself coming back again and again. I have not been disappointed.
author: Katie M.

description:
* intimate, quiet feel to the place, even though its located on NOISY lombard street. 
* good food (portions could be a bit bigger)
* non-attitude Thai waitresses -- cute too
* fast take-out service
author: JJ Z.

description: -1 star for feathers still present and accounted for on the duck in my pumpkin curry. they were small, tiny feathers, but feathers nonetheless.
author: Tiffinie T.

description: chicken pad thai, second best I found in the city and half the price - YUM!
author: Kel K.

description:
I am writing this review from the toilet...

I usually have a tough stomach but Benjarong and I didn't hit it off too well tonight. I really wanted to like this place as a friend had recommended it. Decor was cute and our server was very sweet, so I thought we were off to a good start. Boy was I wrong. We had to wait almost 45 minutes to get the first dish and wait 5-10 minutes for each subsequent dish. The tofu yellow curry was OK, but besides tofu, there was nothing else in the sauce. I will admit the coconut rice was great, but the other dishes were lackluster. The hot basil chicken had a nice flavored sauce but I had a few pieces of suspiciously crunchy chicken that discreetly wound up in my napkin. I tasted my friend's pineapple fried rice and even though I can usually eat every grain of rice on my place, one bite was more than enough for me and the same goes for the pad thai. The pad thai was so sweet and thick with peanut sauce that I didn't have more than a few bites.

With so many other good thai restaurants in the city, I can't imagine any reason to give this place another try. My stomach and toilet will thank me once I recover from this episode.
author: Cher E.

description: Benjarong is the latest addition to my Take-Out-Thursday rotation of restaurants in the Marina. Tasty, fresh and fast Thai. I love the Larb-- minced chicken breast tossed with greens in a spicy dressing!
author: Mama L.

description: had an issue with service. their manager called and apologized like two weeks later, and in my book, that is great. I'll be going back there.
author: Yelper S.

description: I loved the presentation of the food here and it tastes great as well. The ambiance is awesome and the service friendly. I'd definitely go back.
author: Beena A.

description: This place passes my pad thai test.  It's so hard to find a place that gives it the right balance of salty and sweet and not too greasy.  This is one of my favorite neighborhood takeout places.  Huge points in my book for speed - they had my order ready in 5 minutes!
author: Lily K.

description: Benjarong is my favorite restaurant, period.  I have never had thai food as good as this.  This restaurant is one of the things my wife and I miss the most about San Francisco, but we always try to eat here whenever we make it back into town.
author: Bruce T.

description: This place is fantastic thai food. When we went, there was only one other table occupied. Prices are cheap. Go before it gets figured out and they raise them..
author: Aaron M.

description: I normally get their food delivered, and they always deliver it quickly.  Their Summer rolls are the best that I have ever had.  Everything always tastes fresh.  I love their yellow curry, and it is always still super hot once it gets to me.  This is my favorite Thai restaurant in the city.
author: LeAngela S.

description: Ate here this past weekend - overall 4 years, all for the food. While not the best Thai I've eaten in the city, certainly the best in this neighborhood. I've ordered delivery from them before but this was the first time I ate at the restaurant - nothing fancy, just straight up good food. Had the fried spring rolls and the silver noodle salad to start - both were good with the salad being a lot more flavorful. Then had the broccoli beef, panag curry and the phad thai noodles - again, very flavorful and worth the money spent. My biggest gripe with the place is the service - they are extremely short staffed and it shows - they forgot the lemonade altogether and the appetizers and mains took way too long - they forget my rice and by the time I got it the rest of the table had finished their meals with the rice they got with their dishes - other than that I was happy with the place. Their beer and wine license had expired so we had to stick with aqua ...
author: Anon Y.

description: Friendly staff, great food! Their portions are big and they take the time to decorate the dishes. One of my favs in the neighborhood.
author: W L.

description: I ordered the chicken yellow curry  w/ brown rice, and was pretty disappointed with the amount of chicken, and the brown rice was like nothing i've ever seen before- dark brown, dense, and chewy.  The reason I am still giving it 3 stars is that I thought the flavor of the curry sauce itself was excellant.
author: Ethan K.

description: This is a true find.  Amazing food, freindly and prompt service.  My husband and I think this is the best Thai food we've ever had and we've been to $$$$ in Chicago, NYC, LA, and even Thiland.  Food can't be beat and they have a beautiful decor.  Since they are new it isn't crowded yet but I'm sure it will be.  Take Out is available.
author: pam k.

description: Good fun and best of all you never have to wait for a table. I've been here a few times and here are my recommendations: pumpkin curry and vegetarian delight with chicken. Both dishes have incredible flavors. The service is always wonderful and a bonus, they distribute coupons in the mail for buy 1 entree get the second free type of deals. That only makes eating at this place that much sweeter.
author: Stephanie B.

description: Cleanliness is next to Godliness, so Benjarong immediately drew me in with its transitional and CLEAN interiors.  I had been craving Thai food, but was apprehensive about trying just any hole in the wall.  I was pleasantly surprised with Benjarong's Yellow Curry dish (cashews added are a must).  The dowfalls?  There's a minimum for deliveries, and rice doesn't come with the meal.
author: Sophia D.

description: Ok, first let me say that I have not eaten the food here. I came the other night, with 5 others. We sat and waited for our server for about 15 minutes before flagging someone down and ordering drinks. We all ordered drinks two cocktails, two beers, and hot tea.  Another 15 minutes later we flagged down the server again and asked if our drinks were coming and ordered our food. So, we are 30 minutes into our time here and we still have not gotten any of our drinks. Finally the server brings two beers and the tea but not the cocktails. Another 15 minutes pass and we are still  short two drinks. Now 45 minutes into our time here we had no food and only half of the drinks we ordered. Finally, we decide to leave and we notify the waitress that it's taking to long and want to leave and she storms into the back all mad. The must frustrating part is that there were 3 people working there and 3 or 4 tables not including us. Overall it was just a really bad experience.
author: Ms. G.

description: should get 3.5 stars, like it a lot but a little inconsistent; usually get this twice  month, tried all different things; stand outs are clay pot prawns...everything else is pretty good
author: Peter L.
